loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 27 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta noveno grado, luego decidió formar su propio hogar, está casada y ahora tiene tres hijos, los primeros 2 asisten a la escuela y el menor tiene solo 2 años de edad y por esa razón aún no asiste a la escuela y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

María, vende licuados de frutas en su hogar, empezó con este negocio hace 10 años, justo el tiempo que tiene de casada y lo hizo con la intención de generar ingresos y ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, pero además de eso le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura; el terreno en donde tiene sembrado el maíz está a una distancia de medio kilómetro, se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno, arreglar a sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela y luego se dispone a acompañar a su esposo para ayudarle en la agricultura y regresa del campo a las 11 de la mañana para preparar el almuerzo y tener todo preparado para vender los licuados, mientras su vecina le cuida a su hijo menor.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar fertilizantes para 20,123 metros cuadrados de maíz, para tener una cosecha buena y abundante que genere mejores ganancias.

El sueño de María, es que sus hijos se preparen academicamente, para que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo y por ende mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 27 years old, is a homemaker. She completed ninth grade at school and then decided to form her own family. She is married and has three children, the first two go to school and the youngest is not ready for school yet at two years old. Her husband works in agriculture.

Maria has a business selling fruit smoothies from her home. She began this work ten years ago when she got married, with the intention of generating income to help her husband with the household expenses. Additionally, she helps her husband with the farming work on the field where they have their corn crops, located half a kilometer away.

She gets up very early, prepares breakfast, sees the children off to school, and while her neighbor babysits the youngest child, Maria follows her husband to help him on the field, returning home at eleven to prepare lunch and set up her smoothie sales.

This loan is to buy fertilizers for the corn crops on a 20,123 square-meter field. She is looking for a good, abundant harvest to bring in more income.

Maria's dream is to have her children complete a school education that will prepare them for better work opportunities, and thus a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn crops.

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Group

texts.es: Dúo Kairos Violeta  es madre de 2 jóvenes menores de edad, los cuales estudian. Violeta se dedica a la venta de tortillas, huevos y recargas de teléfonos. Ella menciona que gracias a la ayuda de fape a podido surtir mas su negocio y que nuevamente solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz y huevos. Violeta sueña con un local propio y espera poder lograrlo muy pronto.
texts.en: The Dúo Kairos Group:  Violeta is the mother of two minor children who are studying. Violeta works selling tortillas, eggs and telephone re-charges. She mentions that thanks to the support from FAPE she was able to stock her business more and is once again requesting a loan to buy corn and eggs. Violeta dreams of having her own store and hopes to be able to achieve this soon.

loans.use: to buy corn, eggs and electronic recharges for re-sale.

loans.name: Ermia Susana

texts.es:
Ermia es una  mujer ecuatoriana de 31 años de edad nació en la provincia de Tungurahua , perteneciente a la república del Ecuador,  vive en la ciudad de Latacunga en un barrio casi céntrico de la ciudad este barrio se llama Los Nevados, barrio muy  reconocido por los habitantes, ya que es muy comercial , aquí vive con su esposo e hijos en casa arrendada.
Ermia es  una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora siempre se ha preocupado por ser ayuda a su esposo en los gastos  y  justamente por esta razón está solicitando un crédito para emprender con su negocio que se trata de la venta de cosméticos, bisutería y más.
Ermia  agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Ermia is a 31 year old Ecuadorian woman, born in Tungurahua province, which belongs to the republic of Ecuador. 
She lives in the city of Latacunga in a neighborhood called Los Nevados, which is almost in the centre of the city. It is very well known due to its inhabitants, since it is very commercial
She lives here with her partner and children in a rental home.

Ermia is a very hard working and enterprising woman, she has always helped her partner with their expenses, and for exactly this reason she is asking for a loan to start her own business selling cosmetics, jewelry and more things.  

Ermia is thankful to Kiva for making possible the growth in her personal and family life.

loans.use: to start her cosmetics and jewelry business, with these earnings she will be able to support her husband and the family expenses.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPACHE” está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Yajaira es soltera con un 01 dependiente. Ella se dedica a la librería que implemento con mucho esfuerzo hace varios años. Ella tiene como finalidad implementar su bazar y construir su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una exhibidora. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Yajaira es la primera del lado izquierdo. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Andrea en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPACHE” group is made up of responsible and hard-working women. Yajaira is single and has one dependent. She works in a bookstore that she started a few years ago with much effort. She has as goals opening a variety store and building her house. She will use the loan to buy a display case.

The group is grateful to the lenders at Kiva and for the awarded loan. Yajaira is the first person to the left. The insert is s photo of Andrea who could not be at the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Equiteria

texts.es:
Equiteria tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el Centro Poblado san Nicolás que pertenece al Distrito Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes, patos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de materiales para mejorar la infraestructura del corral de sus animales como alambre, malla entre otros para el corral de sus animales y de esta manera tener un mejor distribución y los mismos,así como también para compra de alimentos para engorde de sus animales; con esto Equiteria espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Equiteria is 27 years old and lives with her daughter in San Nicolas, a small community in the Zaña district.  The people in this community work in agriculture, in commerce, and with livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo province. Chiclayo is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. 

Equiteria raises and sells small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and ducks. She runs the business at the back of her house. 

Equiteria has requested a loan to buy materials to improve the animals' pen. She will buy things such as wire and mesh, among others.  With this work done, Equiteria will have a better arrangement.  She will also buy feed to fatten her animals.  With this, Equiteria hopes to offer her customers a better product.  This will allow her to generate greater earnings, which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the animals' pen and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Karen Genesis

texts.es:
Karen  es una joven ecuatoriana  de 22 años, nacida en la ciudad de Ambato , es soltera pero tiene un hijo pequeño vive en casa arrenda desde hace varios años en una zona urbana  de la provincia de Cotopaxi en Ecuador. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres  terminó  la secundaria pero debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios en la universidad.
Actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y  pollos , negocio que realiza hace dos años. Ella  aprendió este oficio de su madre, ella se vio obligada a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su economía pero a pesar de su esfuerzo este negocio familiar no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos generados en el hogar. 
La joven está solicitando un préstamo porque quiere comprar  mas cerdos y pollos y alimento y necesita pagar una deuda, este préstamo la ayudara  crear una nueva fuente de trabajo para así ayudar a sus padres y generar otros ingresos. 
Karen agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Karen is a 22 year old Ecuadorian, born in the city of Ambato. She is single buy has a young son, she has lived in a rented house for many years in an urban zone in Cotopaxi province. Thanks to the efforts of her parents, she finished secondary school but due to her low income she cannot continue with her studies at university. 

At the moment she earns a living raising and selling pigs and chickens, a business which she has done for 2 years. She learnt this from her mother, and was forced to work to help her parents to improve their income. However despite these efforts, this family business is not sufficient to cover the household expenses. 

The youth is asking for a loan because she wants to buy more pigs, chickens and feed, she also need to pay a debt. This loan will help her to create a new source of work and thus help her parents to generate other income.

Karen is grateful to Kiva for making possible the improvement of her working and personal life.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and chickens, from this she will be able to support her parents and help with the costs of the family.

loans.name: Si, Si, Si Group

texts.es: Rosa tiene 37 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella hace varios años expende de manera ambulatoria productos de confitería gaseosas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más confitería y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la que tiene a su hija en brazos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 37, is single and has two dependent children.  She has been selling sweets and soft drinks in an itinerant manner for several years.

She will use the loan to buy sweets and soft drinks.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was provided.  

Rosa is the one who has her arms around her daughter.

loans.use: to buy sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
“I want to help others. Someday I can extend help by giving employment to my neighbors and relatives.” 

This is Joyce’s aspiration. She’s not only concerned about herself, but wishes to succeed together with others. She owns a tricycle and her husband Dandy is a fisherman. They have two children studying in elementary. Her husband drives the tricycle when he’s not out in the sea fishing. But most of the time, Joyce lets one of her neighbors drive her tricycle in exchange for a meager rental fee. In that way, she is giving the driver a source of income. However, there are times when her tricycle breaks down, just like today. 

She has to buy some spare parts and pay for its repair. Thus she implores your generosity to lend her an amount of PhP 8,000 for this purpose. 

She knows that continuous income from the tricycle can help sustain their daily expenses and prepare for her children’s education. She envisions having more tricycle units for rent in the near future, and then she can employ more drivers in the community. Also she would be glad to see her children finish their college education. 

She is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts of her tricycle and pay for its' repair

loans.name: Mary Azucena

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer ecuatoriana  cliente de 60 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia la Matriz tiene 4 hijos pero todo son mayores de edad , vive en casa arrendada desde hace mas de 1 año mas o menos.
El mayor obstáculo en su vida ha sido la separación con su esposo y padre de sus hijo, pese a esto  Mary   no ha escatimado en sacrificarse y dedicarse en un 100% a sus hijo y a darles lo mejor que en sus posibilidades está, ella se dedica a la venta de uniformes útiles escolares y mas, esto ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
El crédito que solicita es para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que esta construyendo y desea hacer unas mejoras 
Mary quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Mary is a 60 year old Ecuadorian female client. She was born in the city of Latacunga, in la Matriz parish. She has four children but they are all adults. She lives in a house that she has leased for more than one year, more or less.

The main obstacle in her life is her separation from her husband and father of her children. In spite of this Mary hasn't shrank away from sacrifice and dedicated herself 100% to her children and give them the best that she possibly could. She works selling school uniforms, supplies and others and this has served her to raise her children.

The loan she is requesting is to make improvements on her house that she is constructing and she wants to do some work.

Mary wants to extend sincere thanks and congratulations to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth in her personal and work life possible.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house as it needs work.

loans.name: Eduvigen De Jesus

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener un negocio sostenible son las metas que motivan a levantarse y trabajar duramente a la señora Eduvigen, quien con su negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras ha logrado ser útil y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

Eduvigen buscando ser más competitiva, más prospera frente a la competencia, perdurar en el tiempo, mejorar las ventas, tener mayor existencia en su granja quiere solicitar un crédito para construir un galpón y comprar gallinas ponedoras y tener una producción de huevos más alta y ser una distribuidora a considerar.

Apoya a una mujer de campo con gran entusiasmo y alegría en su vida!
texts.en:
The main goals of Eduvigen are improving her home and having a sustainable business. She breeds laying hens, and her business has allowed her to be useful, and to help her husband with household expenses.

Eduvigen wants to become more competitive, to flourish, to ensure her business will last, to improve her sales, and to increase her stock on her farm. She is requesting a loan to pay for building a shed and laying hens, so that she can increase the egg production and become a bigger distributor. 

Support this enthusiastic and cheerful country woman!

loans.use: to build a shed and buy laying hens, in order to increase egg production and become a bigger distributor.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 33 years old; she is married with three children.

Christina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Christina has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from fruit and vegetable vending.

Christina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jovelien

texts.en:
Jovelien is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell.

Jovelien has been in this business for years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en: Penelope is a 49-year-old mother with 12 children. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. Penelope requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, a fry pan, and vegetable oil for her business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development in 2015.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Siimoa

texts.en:
Siimoa is a 36-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. 

Siimoa requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, a bottle of mushroom soy sauce, a sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil and containers to help her run the business. 

She hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, a bottle of mushroom soy sauce, a sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil and containers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cleaning products and food items to sell.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
SEGUNDO TIENE 71 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADO, VIVE CON SU ESPOSA, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DEL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU. COMUNIDAD QUE SE DEDICA A LA GANADERIA, AGRICULTURA, Y COMERCIO.

SEGUNDO SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE VENTA DE ABARROTES, GASEOSAS Y GOLOSINAS, DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES. NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO.ÉL SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA AMPLIAR EL STOCK DE SU NEGOCIO. DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
SEGUNDO is 71 years old and married. He lives with his wife in his own house in a large community in the urban area of the district of Cayalti, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo. Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The community is dedicated to raising livestock, agriculture and commerce.

Segundo has been working selling groceries, sort drinks and sweets for more than 10 years and he has very good work and personal references. His business is located in his house. The loan he is requesting is to buy merchandise to expand the stock of his business. In this way he will obtain greater income and be able to improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand the stock of his grocery business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been operating for two years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase a fishing net for her business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net for fishing business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maisha Bora Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 1985 que Jeanne a commencé à cultiver le riz. Il a appris cette culture dans les circonstances qui suivaient son mariage aidé par sa belle-famille. cette activité lui permet de nourrir ses enfants et assurer le paiement de leurs frais scolaires. Ce qui handicape cette activité c'est le manque d'entretien; toutefois, elle a une ambition de produire beaucoup grâce à l'usage de nouvelles semences de paddy, ce qui donnera à sa famille la possibilité d'améliorer leur mode de vie. Présidente du groupe MAISHA BORA, elle tient sa main une feuille.
texts.en: In 1985, Jeanne began growing rice. She learned about this crop given the situation following her marriage, which was supported by her in-laws. This work enables her to feed her children and ensure their school fees are paid. What handicaps this work is the lack of maintenance; in any case, her ambition is to produce big crops through the use of new paddy seeds, which will make improved living conditions possible for her family. Jeanne is the president of the group MAISHA BORA. She is the one holding a leaf.

loans.use: to pay for weeding, fertilizer, plant care products, and labor at harvest time.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old and from Badian, Cebu. She is married and helps her husband by buying and selling scrap. She buys steel, empty plastic bottles and cans. She has relied on this business for eight years now. 

She is in need of an additional capital worth PHP 6,000 to buy more scrap for a living. 

Carmelita's income will provide healthy meals for herself and her husband. She plans to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 66 years old, married to Bernardo, a 68-year-old farmer, and they have children. They are survivors of Typhoon Haiyan that swept the Philippines, especially the Visayas region, in November 2013. 

Letecia runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo and she continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. However, the income derived from her store varies from time to time, as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. 

Aside from this, she has some neighbors who have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes few days or weeks before they pay. The stability of her business is shaken by this practice because it depletes her capital. She is a considerate person who cannot refuse her neighbors, but she also has to earn enough money for their everyday needs and save some amount for their retirement. Self-employed citizens in the Philippines, especially in some remote areas, have no pension or medical benefits when they retire. They have to rely on their own savings or help from other people. With this consideration, Letecia needs to improve her business. 

She plans to buy more items, particularly soft drinks, beverages and grocery items. She is requesting additional capital of PhP 12,000 that will surely boost her income and savings. She’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to her. It will go a long, long way. 

Letecia dreams that all her children would be successful and enjoy better life in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her variety store, specifically soft drinks, beverages and grocery items

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is encouraged that he continuously received help to maintain his vehicle which is a necessity to render safe and consistent service to his passengers. He is glad that he is able to provide for his family through his transportation business. 

He trusts that he can again access a Php 15,000 loan to pay for the annual registration and maintenance of his jeepney. 

It is important that his jeepney is properly maintained to assure him of an efficient service and stable income. He values and takes care of his transportation business well, since this is where he gets the funds to meet his family's everyday needs. He is thanking God and you for the continuous support given him.

Joey's simple dream is to grow his business to give his family a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for annual registration and maintenance of his jeepney.

loans.name: Nemeilyn

texts.en: Nemeilyn is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is still in school. Nemeilyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. Nemeilyn requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and supplies to raise her livestock. She has borrowed six times from NWTF to sustain her business. Nemeilyn would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina has been involved in business activity since 2007. She started her business with her own working capital of $ 1,500. She also raises animals, like pigs, chickens and cows. Sabina is married, and she has seven children; there are nine members in the family, including her husband. Her husband is in agriculture. 

Sabina is selling cows, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional cows.  

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can increase her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Patosina

texts.en:
Patosina is 49 years old with 2 children; she runs a business of selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. 

Patosina requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and a sack of rice to help her run the business. 

She hopes to build a restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and a sack of rice

loans.name: Legalo

texts.en:
Legalo is a 27-year-old woman with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Legalo requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs and containers to assist her run the business. 

She hopes to expand her business using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs and containers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Leah is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets to raise and sell.

Leah has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of fruit to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. she is married and has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now.

Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: Marisol es una mujer trabajadora dedicada a su bodega que implemento en su vivienda. Ella expende productos de primera necesidad y a la vez productos de belleza. Ella es conviviente con tres hijos dependientes. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una exhibidora para sus cosméticos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Marisol es la sexta persona del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Marisol is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to the small general store that she established in her home. She sells staple goods as well as beauty products. She has a partner as well as three dependent children.

She is requesting a loan to buy a new display case for her cosmetics. The group gives thanks to Kiva lenders for the loan. Marisol is the sixth person from the left.

loans.use: to buy a new display case.

loans.name: Victor Saul

texts.es: Victor es un señor casado, padre de familia de sus 3 hijas de 6, 11 y 17 años de edad, Victor tiene 62 años de edad y comenta que son 35 años que se dedica  al negocio de carpintería, la esposa de Victor se dedica a trabajar al jornal, Victor solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la comprar de madera para elaborar los muebles que le hacen pedidos, asi como camas, armarios, puertas entre otros productos que realiza. Victor está contento con su negocio y lo que espera es seguir en el y poder sacar adelante  a su familia sobre todo dar la educación de las 3 chicas.
texts.en: Victor is a married man, father of three daughters 6, 11 and 17 years old. Victor is 62 years old and says that he has worked in the carpentry business for 35 years. Victor´s wife is a day laborer. Victor requests loan money in order to invest it in buying wood to create furniture that is ordered, as well as, beds, cabinets, and doors, among other products. Victor is happy with his business and what he hopes is to continue with it and support his family, especially the education of his three girls.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: John Esneider

texts.es:
John, un hombre de 30 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Marinilla y allí se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo de 1 año

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 4 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de una incubadora y comprar materiales para la adecuación del techo de su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.
Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de John!
texts.en:
John, a 30 year old man full of dreams and aspirations in his life, lives on a farm in the town of Marinilla.  He earns a living through the production and sale of chickens and eggs.  With this work he tries to maintain his family of his wife and one year old son.  

He has been in the business for about four years, trying to succeed.  

He is asking for economic help to purchase an incubator and purchase materials to improve the roof of his shed.  With this loan he will be able to have a more consolidated and sustainable business.  With the loan that you make today you can improve the life and the business of John!

loans.use: to purchase an incubator and materials to improve the roof of his shed.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio is from Badian, Cebu. He is engaged in raising cattle and native chickens in his chicken coop. Anastacio has been struggling in providing his farm animals the required feed. At the moment, he just lets his cattle eat grass and his chickens eat corn kernel. But Anastacio is aware that a quality feed will make his animals healthier and will help fatten them, giving him better return on his investment. He is asking for a loan to buy feed. This feed will help ensure his farm animals' growth will not be compromised.  

In the future, he plans to improve and expand his livelihood for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, and brick in order to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la compra de y venta de granos como menestras, maíz, café, entre otras; con 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado el préstamo para compra de mayor cantidad de menestras y granos para su comercialización; con esto podrá obtener mejores oportunidades generando mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 44 years old and lives in the Pucara District, a community with a warm climate.  It is a peaceful place, and its population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the Province of Jaen in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern sierra of Peru.  

His business is the purchase and sale of grains such as legumes, corn, coffee among others.  

With five years experience in the field, he is asking for the loan to purchase larger quantities of legumes and grains for his business.  With this he will be able to have better opportunities, generating more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of legumes and grains for his business.

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie is from the municipality of Badian, Cebu. She is 35 years old, married with five children, ages 2 to 15. 

Leilanie keeps a farm where she grows string beans. This is her source of income for three years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides. Leilanie is aiming for more harvest with the help of the loan. Her income will be for the education of her children and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Veatrina

texts.en: Veatrina lives in Atsabe. She has been involved in business activities since 2007. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 because she is a businesswoman and she has a kiosk. She is very interested in her business, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies such as soap, glue, cigarettes, noodles, biscuits and other things to sell. She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her future income.

loans.use: To buy soap, glue, cigarettes, noodles, biscuits and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 62 years old, from Pasay City. She’s married to Antonio and they have two children. At her old age, Yolanda can still manage a small canteen or food stall which is commonly known in the Philippines as “carinderia”. She has been running this carinderia for almost twenty years and it has been very helpful in providing for her family’s daily needs and children’s education. 

Yolanda’s business is considered valuable because many Filipino families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal.  If there is only one or two family members present for dinner, they would prefer to buy cooked viand or food. This is a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Yolanda’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, students and working people. 

The canteen business is quite exhausting especially for Yolanda who is already at her retirement age. She has to wake up very early and sleep late at night, but she persists because she has to prepare for her retirement. Self-employed Filipinos don’t usually receive pension or medical benefits when they retire. This is the reason why Yolanda needs to improve her business, increase her income and save some amount for her retirement. She is requesting a loan worth 20,000 PHP that she will use to buy more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Your generosity may ease her burden. It will be very much appreciated.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Arieta

texts.en: Arieta is 22 years old and single with one child. She sell pancakes in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Arieta needs a loan to buy cooking oil, a cooking pot, shopping bags, flour, etc. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in June this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy corn flour,shopping bags,yeast, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is so grateful for the16,000 PHP loan which she used for maintenance of her tricycle unit. It helped render safe and consistent service to her passengers. She values her transportation business so much for this is her only source of income. 

She is now again humbly asking for your assistance with another PHP16,000 loan to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle. It is important that her tricycle is properly maintained to assure her of an efficient service and stable income. Being a widow, is not easy for her but she does her best to take care of her business as this enables her to support herself and her aging parents. She is thanking God for your good heart as she receives support for her livelihood. 

Eufemia's simple dream is to sustain her transportation business and hopefully acquire another tricycle. She prays for God to bless her abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.es: NIXON: Es un señor amable y luchador de 58 años de edad. Casado con un hijo mayor de edad. Su esposa trabaja como docente de escuela de educación primaria en la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Él cuenta con una experiencia como oftalmólogo de más de 2 décadas. Debido a la problemática de agua y saneamiento en el municipio, compraba agua para beber incrementado los gastos del hogar. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida, solicita su primer financiamiento para construir un pozo perforado y beber agua segura y limpia. Él sueña con dedicarse a actividades agropecuarias, particularmente en el cultivo del cacao.
texts.en:
Nixon is a friendly hard working man of 58 years.  He is married and has an older son.  His wife works as a docent in a primary school in the city of Bilwi, Municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  

He has more than two decades experience as an ophthalmologist.  Due to the problematic water and sanitation in the town, he was buying drinking water, which increased their household expenses.  

With the goal of providing his family better health and quality of life, he is asking for his first loan to construct an underground well, in order to drink water that is safe and clean.  He dreams of dedicating himself to agriculture and livestock, particularly the cultivation of cacao.

loans.use: to construct an excavated well.

loans.name: Tuputala

texts.en: Tuputala is a 28-year-old mother of three children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumbers, and eggplant, in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tuputala requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumbers, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Buy-and-sell businesses earn profits from buying products at a low price and selling them at a higher price. The entrepreneur’s skills in finding network manufacturers and suppliers who offer low prices for their products is one major key in the success of this business, as well as the capacity to expand their market. 

Amador is into buying and selling products such as mat bags and umbrellas. He sells along the street and in front of a church, to entice church goers and passersby. He braves the rain and heat of the sun so he can supply the daily needs and education expenses of his children. He is a widower with three children. Sometimes his income is not enough, thus he plans to buy more bags and umbrellas. He knows that these items will be in demand this rainy season. He needs additional capital of 10,000 PHP to procure these products. Your generosity will be a great blessing to him and his children.  

Amador dreams of a better living condition someday, and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional bags and umbrellas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, chips, meat, seasonings and condiments

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en: Terezinha Lives in Atsabe, is married and has one child. She is a business woman so she is applying for a loan of (USD) $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking out this loan because she wants to buy more goods such as slippers, ball, detergents, sheath cloth and other things to sell. Terezinha started her business in 2009 with working capital of (USD) $500. She sells on market days, earning a good income from her business because many people are interested in her items, So she is very happy with her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to manage her business well.

loans.use: To buy slippers, ball, detergents, sheath cloth and other things to sell.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is 19 years old, single, and has no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy corn flour, yeast, a cooking pot, a frying pan, etc. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elisapeta will save her profit to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, yeast, a cooking pot, and a frying pan

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, etc. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like biscuits, bread, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Olga Maura

texts.es: Olga tiene  37 años de edad, ella es madre soltera , tiene 4 hijos de 2, 8, 12, 17 años y 2 hijas de 3, 15 años de  edad, Olga se dedica  a trabajar al diario de trabajos de agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, Olga solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar una vaca ya que comenta que mediante la venta de la leche es como obtiene otro ingreso mas para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Olga tiene 4 hijos estudiando y comenta que para ella es muy  duro pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos por lo menos que lleguen a ser bachilleres.
texts.en:
Olga is 37 years old.  She is a single mother.  She has four sons, ages 2, 8, 12, and 17, and two daughters, ages 3 and 15.  Olga has four children in school and says that it is very difficult to pay her children’s educational expenses until they at least graduate from high school.  

Olga works daily farming and raising cattle.  Olga is asking for the money from a loan in order to buy a cow because she says that selling milk is how she can get another source of income to cover the expenses of her home.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Amparita

texts.en:
Amparita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Amparita has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Vitolia

texts.en:
Vitolia is a 51-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cake, and buns in her village to earn a living.

Vitolia has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, a  frying pan, a wooden spoon, and plastic bags for use in running her business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future, using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, a  frying pan, a wooden spoon, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Alycia

texts.es: Doña Alycia de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Alycia, 60, lives in her own home with her husband.  For 10 years she has been cultivating corn and beans.  When her harvest is ready,she sells it in the surrounding towns.  She already has a lot of regular customers.   Alycia is requesting a loan to buy seeds,organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides,and other supplies, and to improve the land seen in the photograph.  This way she can continue with her farming activity and increase her income, because this is her only source of work,

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to improve her land

loans.name: Yenny Angela

texts.es: Yenny  tiene 23 años de edad es soltera dedicada a sus estudio de su carrera de contabilidad. Ella se siente muy contenta ya que solo le falta 1 años y tres meses para terminar su carrera profesional. Su objetivo es poner su propio estudio contable. Ella en sus tiempos libres trabaja como ayudante de cocina. El crédito lo invertirá en la pago de las pensión universitaria. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Yenny is 23 years old and single.  She is dedicated to her studies in the career of accounting.  She is very content since she only has one year and three months left until she finishes her professional degree.  Her goal is to open her own accounting office.  In her free time, she works as a kitchen helper.  She will invest this loan to pay university costs.  She is thankful to Kiva lenders for the funding this loan.

loans.use: to pay for university costs.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, sus pobladores se dedican al cultivo y venta de café, cacao y frutales dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Orlando se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 03 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Orlando espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is 41 years old and lives with his children in the San Felipe district.  Here the residents work in agriculture and sell coffee, cocoa and fruits.  This area is two hours from the city of Jaen, in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Orlando provides transportation services with his moto-taxi.  He has been doing this work for more than 3 years.  He has experience in the area, and has very good personal and work references.  He will use this loan to make some repairs and do maintenance work on his vehicle, since it is currently in bad condition.  With this investment, Orlando hopes to offer better service to his customers, thereby increasing his income and enabling him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: ALBERTINA: Es una mujer cordial, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 36 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 hijo: El mayor de 12 años estudia su quinto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 5 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijos, trabaja como acopiadora de pescados y mariscos y para incrementar su nivel de ingresos, para solventar los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde  hace 6 años estableció una pequeña pulpería.  Esta solicitando financiamiento para: pan huevo, granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas, candelas, shampoo, detergentes, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con construir su vivienda de concreto para brindarle mayor seguridad y calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Albertina is a polite woman.  She is part of the Miskita ethnic group in the town of Puerto Cabezas.  She is 36 years old and is the single mother of two children.  The older one, age 12, is a student in the fifth grade, and the younger one is five years old.  With the goal of getting her children ahead, she works as a fish and seafood wholesaler.  She has done this in order to cover her household expenses and her children’s education.  

Six years ago she set up her own small store.  She is asking for a loan to buy egg bread, basic grains, snacks, soda, candles, shampoo, and detergents, among other products.  She dreams of building her own home out of concrete in order to give her children more safety and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy egg bread, basic grains, snacks, soda, candles, shampoo, and detergents, among other products

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annabelle is 49 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Annabelle has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Annabelle has been in this business for 40 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en: Mavaega is 45 years old with six children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Mavaega requested for a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: Martha es una chica de 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de los cuales uno asiste a la escuela, ella es una mujer que ha demostrado tener mucha capacidad para emprender su propio negocio, y aunque todavía vive en una casa arrendada, no pierde la esperanza de llegar a tener una propia, esta persona se caracteriza por tener un espíritu de superación por ello ha solicitado un crédito a nuestra institucion, el cual va a ser destinarlo a la compra de una vaca para incrementar su pequeño negocio, su anhelo mas grande es  mediante la rentabilidad de su negocio poder dar a sus hijos una casa propia en donde puedan sentirse a gusto, ella es una persona muy optimista y sabe que algun día con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Martha is a 24 year-old girl who lives with her husband and their two children, one of whom goes to school. She is woman who has showed a great deal of ability to start her own business. Although she still lives in a rented house, she does not lose hope of getting to have her own.

She is known for having a spirit of excellence and thus has applied for a loan with our institution, which will be used to purchase a cow in order to grow her small business. Her greatest desire is that through the profitability of her business she can give her children their own house where they can feel at ease.

She is a very optimistic person and knows that some day, with much effort and dedication, she is going to achieve it.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Myrian Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Myrian es una mujer luchadora, de estado civil soltera tiene 9 años de residencia y dos hijos de 4 y 12 años, vive en el sector de Tulipe –Nanegalito a una hora del Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos.
Doña Myrian viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual solo tiene estudios primarios a pesar de esto salió adelante trabajando como empleada doméstica y realizando la limpieza en una escuela del sector, desea emprender su negocio de crianza y engorde de pollos  esta actividad  la aprendió por iniciativa propia le dedicara un promedio de dos horas diarias para poder dar a sus hijos lo necesario, en la actualidad sigue luchando día a día por ellos quienes son su razón de vivir espera seguir adelante para que sus hijos valoren el sacrificio que ella hace por ellos.
La Sra. Myrian tiene muchos sueños por cumplir como lo es tener su gran negocio y dedicarse solo a eso y dejar de trabajar para otras personas. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Doña Myrian a mejorar su calidad de vida y darle un mejor futuro a sus hjos, agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como ella que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Myrian is a determined and hard-working woman.  She is single and has two children, ages 4 and 12.  She's been a resident for 9 years and lives in the Tulipe-Nanegalito sector, an hour from Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos.  Myrian comes from a family with little economic resources, which is why she only finished primary school.  In spite of this, she has pressed forward by working as a domestic employee and doing the cleaning in a local school.  

She wishes to launch her business raising chickens, a trade she learned through her own initiative.  She will dedicate an average of 2 hours per day to give her children what's necessary.  Currently, she continues fighting day after day for them since they are her reason for living.  She hopes to continue forward so that her children value the sacrifices that she makes for them.

Myrian has many dreams to accomplish like having a great business and being able to dedicate herself only to this and not have to work for other people.  This loan will help Myrian to improve her quality of life and to give a better future to her children.  She is grateful to KIVA for the support they are offering to people like her who due to lack of opportunities, haven't been able to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to launch her business raising chickens, and thus to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is 58 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store in a rural village, selling items such as snacks, cookies, chicken, sausages, etc. She has been doing this for three years. Luisa needs a loan to buy a display cooler, toiletries, snacks, canned foods, freezer food, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to buy a family vehicle to help her with her business shopping. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy display cooler, toiletries, snacks, canned foods, freezer food, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and has five children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her business.

Josephine has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Antonieta works hard to support her family. She has a direct selling business in the Philippines, selling a collection of personal care products, and she also earns income from a general store

Antonieta is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more personal care products like shampoo, lotion, hair conditioners, body spray, etc. to sell through her direct selling business.

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products like shampoo, lotion, hair conditioners, body spray, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta y reparación de llantas desde hace varios años, su padre fue quien le enseño ese trabajo, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas llantas y repuestos por mayor y así continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated (because he is 27-years-old and lives in a high risk zone) for several years has made a living selling and repairing tires. His dad taught him the trade, and his business is located in his home residence. With the earnings from the business he can move forward. 

The young man lives in his own home with his family. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase tires and replacement parts in bulk so that he can continue with his work given that it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Muaau

texts.en:
Muaau is 33 years old and single with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes and ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Muaau has requested a loan to buy yeast, cooking oil, flour, shopping bags, cordial, a bag of sugar, etc. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Muaau will save her profit to extend her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy shopping bags, yeast, flour, sugar, cordial, etc.

loans.name: Fredy Natividad

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre de 27 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 1 y 5 años, ellos viven en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá, para Fredy el que su familia no parezca de necesidades es muy importante es por  ello que todos los días sale a trabajar bajo el ardiente sol como jornalero, esta labor lo tiene el desde hace cinco años, pero Fredy es un hombre de grandes metas y sueños que uno de sus más grandes anhelos es la construcción de una vivienda más cómoda para su familia, aunque una de las dificultades que él tiene es no contar con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus materiales como cemento, block, hierro y arena por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Fredy es poder construir su casa antes de finalizar este año para el bienestar de su querida familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is a 27-year old man. He has a nice family with three children between the ages of 1 and 5 years. They live in a community in the department of Sololá. For Fredy, it is very important that his family not be needy. That is why everyday he heads off to work under the scorching sun as a day laborer. He has been doing this work for the past five years.

Fredy is a man of grand goals and dreams, and one of his greatest desires is to build a more comfortable house for his family. However, one of his greatest difficulties is not having enough money to buy the materials he needs, such as cement, cinder block, iron, and sand. That is why he is applying for a loan to cover this need.

Fredy's great dream is to be able to build his house before the end of the year for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, cinder block, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Anjelita

texts.en:
A USD 800 loan is offered to Anjelita to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as Fanta, noodles, rice, beer, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, shop, bread, biscuits, and slippers. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Anjelita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, noodles, rice, beer, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, shop, bread, biscuits, and slippers

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is married and has five children. She is a businesswomen and her husband is in agriculture.

She is very highly interested in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2000 with her own working capital of $1,000, and she did her best with it.

She made her income from selling a cow, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more cows. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Ngi's Group

texts.en:
Ngi’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ngi makes a living cultivating rice and selling fish to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sovath's Group

texts.en:
Sovath’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sovath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hout's Group

texts.en: Hout’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hout makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as village coordinator to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Suega

texts.en:
Suega is a 36-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business of cooking rice and curry and sells them in her community to earn a living.

Suega has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a box of curry, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a bottle of vegetable oil, a sack of potatoes, a sack of onions, plastics bags, a container, and a gas stove for use in running her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2013. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a box of curry, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a bottle of vegetable oil, a sack of potatoes, a sack of onions, plastics bags, a container, and a gas stove.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 29 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling popcorn in her community and has been doing this for two years. Elena has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, shopping bags, corn grains, a cooking pot, etc. She joined SPBD in June of this year, 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elena will save her profit for her child's education and for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a frying pan, shopping bags, and a cooking pot

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Criselda is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Criselda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Criselda has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en: Adelaide lives in Atsabe. She is married and has one child. She has been doing business since the year 2000 with her own working capital of $1500. She is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store including  sugar, salt, soap, cooking oils, detergents, lotion, sardines, milk, noodles, water, tea, Including soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell. There are three members in her family: herself, one child, and her husband. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, detergents, lotion, sardines, milk, noodles, water, tea, Including soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sok does work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is encouraged and thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. There are instances where she struggles collecting her receivables, but her perseverance pays off as she earns enough to feed and send her children to school.

She is now hoping to access another 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods. She needs to offer as many essential food items as possible to compete with other stores nearby. Her store is her only source of income to feed her family and support her children's education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Marites aims to sustain and grow her store. She prays for God to bless their lives abundantly. Every week, she meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling roasted whole pig in the Philippines.

Filomena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs and other ingredients for her business.  She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Filomena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and other ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ginalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for five years now.

Ginalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hugo Geovanny

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha sus fiestas de Cantonización las celebran el 17 de julio de todos los años y sus fiestas religiosas en honor a San Miguel Arcangel Virgen de los Remedios las celebran en el mes de septiembre.
En un Recinto de este sector San Bernabé Playas del Río Blanco vive desde hace 10 años Hugo, un hombre que es soltero pero tiene dos hijos, uno de 9 meses y otro de dos años, a pesar de no vivir con su familia no les ha desamparado al contrario siempre está pendiente de lo que necesitan. 
Hugo se dedica a las labores del campo ya que tiene una finca en la misma tiene plantaciones de cacao, tilapia y cerdos a los cuales les dedica un promedio de 3 horas diarias se considera un hombre muy trabajador que desde niño ha sabido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y alimento para los cerdos.  
Hugo agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas ya que es la única institución que se preocupa por las personas que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the Love county, is a county of a warm, humid climate. It has several places to rest that are highly visited by national tourists and foreigners, and it is located in the north-west of the Pichincha providence. Every year, the county's anniversary is celebrated on July 17th, and during September they also celebrate their religious festivities in honor of San Miguel Arcangel Virgen de los Remedios. 

Hugo has lived for 10 years in a precinct of this county, San Bernabé Playas del Rio Blanco. He is a single man but has two children, a 9-month-old and a 2-year-old. Although he does not live with his family, he hasn't abandoned them and instead he has always been on the lookout of their needs. 

Hugo makes a living working in the field because he owns some land were has has planted cacao, and he raises tilapia (a type of fish) and pigs, who take up to 3 hours of his life everyday. He considers himself a hardworking man because since he was a kid he has been been able to move forward with a lot of effort and sacrifice. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and food for the pigs. 

Hugo thanks Kiva for the support and the opportunities that have been given to him because it is the only institution that worries about the people that wish to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and food for his little animals, so that he can continue supporting his children and his family.

loans.name: Chae's Group

texts.en: Chae’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chae makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Neam's Group

texts.en:
Neam’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Neam makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en:
Constantina live in Atsabe; she is married and she has five children. She is a businesswomen and she sells coffee beans. If already coffee season, she begins to weigh the coffee from place to place, after which she returns to the coffee export company. 

So now she is requesting a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business and also to improve her management. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more coffee beans. Constantina takes this loan with her husband to add with their working capital to run their business, because it's become their activity.

loans.use: to buy coffee beans.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sarin does work as a farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help this man and each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hort's Group

texts.en: Hort’s group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Hort makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Layheang's Group

texts.en: Layheang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Layheang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phalla makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gladys Tatiana

texts.es:
