Las socias del Grupo De Crédito U.R.S.A. se reúnen cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, que es el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
La señora Gladys tiene 44 años, es casada y de este matrimonio tiene 3 hijos, 2 estudian en la Universidad y uno el colegio, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada.
Doña Gladys para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende productos de belleza y productos naturales al mismo  tiempo que realiza sus otros trabajos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y cosméticos. Lleva cuatro años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la agilidad de los créditos, el trato del promotor que se desempeña como buen líder del grupo.  Sus sueños tener un SPA.
texts.en:
The members of the U.R.S.A. community bank meet every 2 weeks in the city of Manta, which is the most important, popular, and most visited thermal bath in Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches, Ecuador and South America's first deep water port.

Gladys is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are in university and one who is in high school. Her husband works at a private company.

In order to earn her own money and help her husband out with expenses for maintaining the home and paying for their children's education, Gladys started a beauty salon in her house many years ago. Here she does a variety of tasks such as hair dying, hair cuts, nail polishing, and other things. She works every day from 8:00am until 10:00pm, and sometimes later if her customers need her services. She also sells beauty products and natural products at the same time that she does her other work.

She is going to use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, and cosmetics. She has been in the community bank for four years, and she likes it for the flexibility of the loans and the interaction with the facilitator who acts as the leader of the group. Her dream is to have a spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents and cosmetics.

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en: Norn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Norn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a doctor's assistant to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: MARBELY: Es una mujer sonriente, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 28 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: El mayor de 11 años estudia su cuarto de primaria y 2 menores de edad. Desde  hace 5 años habitan en una casa de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna, solicita su primer financiamiento para cambiar la madera que se encuentra deteriorada y comprar: Clavos, zinc, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con construir su casa de concreto para brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
MARBELY:  She is a joyful woman, belonging to the Miskita ethnic group of the Puerto Cabezas municipality. She is 28-years-old, and is married with 3 children: the oldest son is 11-years-old and is in his fourth year of elementary school, and two minors. 

For fives years they have lived in a plastic and wood house. With the purpose of providing her family with descent housing, she is requesting her first loan to change the wood that is now deteriorated and to purchase: nails, zinc, wood, and to cover the labor costs. 

She and her husband dream of building a concrete house to bring greater security to their children.

loans.use: to change the wood that is deteriorated

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Rina is 18 years old and is the fifth of five children in the family. Her mother Carmela, supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rina is studying a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently on her third of this 4-year course. Carmela is borrowing PHP 8,165 to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year, 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Rina plans to be gainfully employed so she can help improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela es una señora muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo en casa propia junto a un hijo que ya trabaja independiente.
Ángela desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a la venta de mariscos, ella recorre a todos sus clientes, compra en el mercado de mariscos y distribuye. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante, ha progresado mucho que incluso gracias al esfuerzo de este trabajo pudo adquirir su casa y darles la educación a sus hijos. 
A pesar de todo comenta que ella no descansa, cuando el pescado sube de precio se dedica a vender otra variedad pero nunca está de manos cruzadas; Ángela es clienta nueva para la fundación con este crédito va a comprar más variedad de mariscos para con estos ingresos luego comprarse un congelador más grande para dedicarse también a vender desde su domicilio.
Está agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Angela is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house in the city of Santo Domingo, with one of her sons who is already working independently. 

For several years now Angela has worked selling fish and shellfish. She consults with all her clients, buys in the seafood market, and distributes her wares. This business has allowed her to earn a living, and even to get ahead some, because through her efforts in this job she was able to buy her house and educate her children. 

Despite all this, Angela says that she can never rest. When the price of one type of fish goes up, she sells a different variety, but she can never just sit and twiddle her thumbs. 

Angela is a new client for the foundation and with this loan she will buy a wider variety of fish and shellfish; With the increased income she will buy a bigger freezer so that she can also sell from her home. 

She appreciates very much the opportunity to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of fish and shellfish, and eventually, with the increased income, buy a bigger freezer and expand her business.

loans.name: Yort's Group

texts.en:
Yort’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yort makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help this man and each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Richo Group

texts.en:
The group members are three women who live in the same neighborhood. Their goal is to make a profit that will contribute to household expenses and help them get ahead. 

The representative of the group is Victoria, who is an example of a fighter. At 35 years old, she has been selling wigs and cosmetics as a vendor alone in the street. Her 5-year-old son goes to school. She will invest the money in buying wigs and cosmetics which she will sell to customers.

The other members are Elizabeth, 58 years old, who works selling smoked fish, and Ruby, 37 years old, who works selling second hand clothing.

loans.use: To buy wigs and cosmetics to sell to customers.

loans.name: Necla

texts.en:
Necla is married and has a child. She has been selling Amway products for eight months. She started this activity in order to have additional income to contribute to the family budget and to earn her own pocket money. She usually sells when visiting her relatives and friends. She aims to have a healthy life and to marry off her son.  With the help of the loan she is going to buy Amway products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Necla Hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Sekiz aydır Amway ürün satışı yapıyor.  Ek gelir elde etmek için başlamış.  Çevresine ve akrabalarına  satış yapıyor.  Sürekli Akrabalarını ziyaret için gidiyor giderken de ürünlerini de götürüp satışını yapıyor.  Kendi harçlığını  çıkarmak için yapıyor.  Amacı sağlıklı bir yaşam ve oğlunu evlendirmek istiyor.  Aldığı kredi ile Amwey ürünleri alıp siparişlerini karşılayacak.

loans.use: to buy Amway products

loans.name: Mónica Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Brillantes se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leónidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Monica, tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su marido trabaja en una camaronera.
Doña Mónica es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella vende manualidades por catalogo (letras, figuras y otros adornos hechos en fomix y otros materiales), ella sale a vender por la localidad y en varios centros educativos de la ciudad que ya son sus clientes más frecuentes, vende a crédito y cobra por semanas o quincenas,  sus ventas son muy buenas ya que no tiene mucha competencia en este tipo de artículos,  llevan 4 años que se dedican a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar manualidades. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The credit group Mujeres Brillantes [Bright Women] meets every 15 days in the Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited at all times of the year and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty, which attracts many tourists.

Here lives Monica, 41, who is in a common-law relationship. They have a 6-year-old son who attends school. Her husband works in the shrimp industry. 

Monica is a woman who likes to work to help with household expenses. She sells craft items by catalog (letters, figures, and other ornaments made from clay foam and other materials). She goes out to sell throughout the town and at several educational centers in the city where she finds her most frequent customers. She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks. Sales are very good because she does not have much competition for these items. She has done this work for four years.

This loan is for buying crafts. She has been a member of this group for three years and likes it because the loans help her progress. Her dream is to give the best to her child.

loans.use: to purchase crafts to sell

loans.name: Matilde Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Brillantes se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leónidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene  60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos mayores de edad e independientes, su mamá vive con ellos. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. 
Doña Matilde es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, ropa interior de Leoniza y productos Yanbal, Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella tiene unas vitrinas en su casa en las cuales exhibe sus productos los mismos que vende a crédito y al contado, llevan 10 años que se dedican a esta actividad la cual le permite ir mejorando su vida cada vez mas.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, productos Yanbal y Belcorp. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y su vida.
texts.en:
The credit group Mujeres Brillantes [Bright Women] meets every 15 days in the Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited at all times of the year and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty, which attracts many tourists.

Here lives Matilde, 60, who is married. They have four grown and independent children. Her mother lives with them. Her husband is a security guard. 

Matilde is a woman who likes to work to help with household expenses. She sells clothing of all kinds as well as lingerie and products from Leoniza, Yanbal, and Belcorp (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). She has a showcase in her home where she displays her products and sells them for cash and on credit. She has done this work for 10 years, which allows her to continue improving her life more and more. 

This loan is for buying clothes and products from Belcorp and Yanbal. She has been a member of this group for four years and likes it because the loans help her progress. Her dreams are to improve her business and her life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and products from Yanbal and Belcorp

loans.name: Nilda Esther

texts.es: Nilda es una es una mujer de 51 años de edad y su residencia está ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, inició su negocio con la premisa de que el tiempo se debe ocupar y que mejor forma de hacerlo en lo que le gusta y generando recursos para su familia. Siendo madre soltera puesto que enviudó joven, hace ocho 8 años está dedicada al comercio de calzado, ropa y perfumes que ofrece a través de una empresa de ventas por catálogo a la que  logró incorporarse como consultora;  realiza su actividad cada quince días de 9:00 a 11:00 a.m. y de 3:00 a 5:00  p.m., mediante visitas puerta a puerta a sus vecinos del barrio. Los resultados de su actividad comercial le han permitido sostener a su familia y su satisfacción evidencia claramente que su pasión por los negocios es total. En la actualidad está tramitando su primer credikiva, a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, inversión con la que proyecto comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos en su casa y aprovechar los bajos precios que se obtienen al comprar ropa y calzado al por mayor lo que espera le genere un mayor margen de utilidad.  Su sueño de prosperidad es poder a largo plazo adquirir su casa propia y organizar su almacén.
texts.en: Nilda is 51 years old. Her house is located in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad. She started her business with the idea that she should occupy her time and that the best way to do it was to do what she liked and generate money for her family from it. Being a single mother, as she was widowed young, she started a business selling footwear, clothing and perfume. She offered these through a company with catalog sales which she managed to become a consultant for. She does her business every two weeks from 9 am to 11 am and 3 pm to 5 pm by visiting her neighbors. The rewards of her commercial activity have allowed her to support her family and her satisfaction is evidence of her total passion for business. She is currently processing her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an investment she is planning to use to buy a display case to exhibit her products in her house to take advantage of the low prices that she gets buying wholesale clothing and footwear. She hopes to generate a greater profit margin. Her dream for prosperity in the long term is to acquire her own house and organize her store.

loans.use: to buy a display case to exhibit her products in her house to take advantage of the low prices that she gets buying wholesale clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en:
Korn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In Korn’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. To help alleviate this problem Korn is applying for a 780,000 KHR loan from Kiva's field partner iDE – Cambodia for her group to buy water filters. Having a water filter at home will help the group’s members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda y una pupuseria ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene un años de tener dichos negocios de los cuales ha podido salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería para su tienda como: sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated because she is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has a small store and a pupuseria (pupusa restaurant) located in her place of residence. She has had those businesses, with which she has been able to get ahead, for one year. The young woman lives in  her own house with her family group, she is applying for a loan for the purchase of merchandise for her store such as: soup, eggs, staple foods, soft drinks, candy, pan dulce, etc. and thus be able to have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy soup, eggs, staple foods, soft drinks, candy, pan dulce, etc.

loans.name: Sokin's Group

texts.en:
Sokin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice, raising chickens and doing extra farm work to support her family.

To help alleviate this problem Sokin is applying for a 780,000 KHR loan from Kiva's field partner iDE – Cambodia for her group to buy water filters. Having a water filter at home will help the group’s members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María delfina es una mujer carismática, luchadora, una empresaria que aprovecha muy bien sus tiempos muertos, puesto que se dedica a la confección de línea propia y atender una tienda de abarrotes, es separada quedando como cabeza de familia y a cargo de su único hijo.

María trabaja por un motivo, crear una empresa sostenible en el tiempo y poder dejarla a su hijo, que tenga algo como sostenerse en el caso de que ella falte.

En vista de que tiene que mantener dos negocios, su hogar, su hijo, ella necesita un apoyo económico para comprar la materia prima para trabajar, con el monto solicitado quiere comprar telas para confeccionar prendas las cuales o hace el fin de semana y el resto del capital en surtido de abarrotes y refrescos.
texts.en:
María Fidelina is a charismatic, tenacious, and entrepreneurial woman who takes good advantage of her down time. She is devoted to making her own line of dresses and managing a grocery store. She is separated, leaving her as the head of the family and responsible for her only son. María works for a reason: to create a sustainable business over time and be able to leave it to her son so that he has something to sustain him should she not have enough. 
Since she has to maintain two businesses, her home, her son, she needs financial support to buy raw materials to work with. With the amount requested, she wants to buy fabrics to make clothing which she makes on the weekends and the rest of the capital on an assortment of groceries and refreshments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to make clothing.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Con 47 años de edad Lidia siempre ha mostrado tenacidad y empeño, ya que desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de calzado, ropa y lociones, gracias al apoyo recibido con un crédito anterior, por lo que se siente feliz, de poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Lidia vive junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad en vivienda propia, la cual también ha logrado mejorar poco a poco con las ganancias de su negocio. Lidia desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y ella teme que en este invierno la situación del mismo empeore, por lo que buscando la manera de proteger a su hijo ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines y mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, esperando volver a contar con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Lidia, aged 47, has always been tenacious and determined. For the last year, she has been selling shoes, clothing and lotions thanks to a previous loan she received, which made her happy as she was able to improve her family's quality of life. Lidia lives with her 11-year-old son in her own home, which she has managed to improve little by little thanks to the earnings from her business. 

Lidia wants to change the roof of her home, which is in a poor condition, and she worries that it will get worse during the winter. She wants to protect her child, and is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI to pay for galvanized sheet metal, beams, poles, pins and labor costs for changing the roof. She hopes to be able to count on this support once again.

loans.use: to pay for galvanized sheet metal, beams, poles, pins and labor costs for changing the roof of her home.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Don Adrian de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde  hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Don Adrian esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es us fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Adrian is 58 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has worked growing corn for 15 years. He sells his products in the surroundings of the area where he lives. 

Adrian is requesting a loan once more for the purchase of more fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc. to be able to improve his land, which is shown in the picture. This way, he can continue working since this is his source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc. to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair his parents’ wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
Hoy’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. To help alleviate this problem Hoy is applying for a 312,000 KHR loan from Kiva's field partner iDE – Cambodia for her and her group member to buy water filters. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Brillantes se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leónidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora Mirian, tiene 48 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijas de 30 y 13 años de edad, la menor estudia en  colegio y es la que aun vive con ella.
Doña Mirian es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para el sustento de ella y su hija, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, productos naturales y  joyas de plata, ella también es artesana elabora carteras tejidas a mano que ella que vende junto con sus otras prendas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Ella también los fines de semana prepara bocaditos y comida para fiestas, por lo general cada semana tiene un compromiso social. Lleva más de 25 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas, joyas, material para laborar carteras y víveres. Esta desde el inicio  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The Dazzling Women credit group meets every 15 days in the Leonidas Proaño community, located in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that enjoy visitors all year round, as well as its unsurpassed beauty and numerous tourist attractions. 

This is where Mirian lives. She is 48 years old and divorced. She had 2 daughters from her marriage, that are now 30 and 13 years old. The youngest is in secondary school and still lives with her. 

Mirian is someone who likes to work to support herself and her daughter. Her business is selling things, including all kinds of clothing, bedding, natural products, and silver jewelry. She is also a craftswoman, and sells her hand-made purses along with her other products. She sells from door to door, offering her products on credit and collecting payments every 8 or 15 days. On weekends she also prepares appetizers and meals for parties, and she generally has a social event every week. She has been operating this business for more than 25 years, and it allows her to make a living. 

This loan will be used to buy clothes, bedding, jewelry, material for making purses and other supplies. She has been a member of the credit group since the beginning and likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to give the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bedding, jewelry, material for making purses and other supplies.

loans.name: Nicolas Eloy

texts.es: Eloy es un hombre de 36 años que vive junto a su pareja y su pequeño hijo en la localidad rural de Huanca, ubicado en el departamento de Arequipa. Eloy se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, actualmente tiene un pequeño cultivo orgánico sembrado el cual espera poco tiempo para realizar la cosecha. También cría ganado vacuno y solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar pequeños terneros orgánicos. En el futuro espera poder darle a su hijo una buena educación y seguridad económica para su pequeño hogar.
texts.en: Eloy, 36, lives in Huanca, in Arequipa province, with his wife and young son. He has a farming and livestock business. He has a small crop of organics that he expects to harvest very soon. He also keeps cattle and is applying for a loan that he will use to buy calves for his organic meat business. His hopes for the future are to provide his son with a good education and his family with a steady, secure income.

loans.use: To buy cattle for his organic beef business

loans.name: Tet Fret De Dumas Group

texts.fr:
Coeurzilia est le coordinatrice de son groupe Tet Fret de Dumas. Elle habite dans la région de Dumas où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Elle a dirigé son commerce de produit alimentaires pendant 10 années. Elle a payé son bien et ceci est votre prêt de 9 avec Esperanza internacional. Elle a acheté de la farine, du riz, de l'huile de cuisson, le sucre, etc.

Des autres membres et Coeurzilia terminent leur prêt d'obtenir un autre, ils se servent de ce prêt pour acheter des vêtements, des chaussures, cosmétiques, produits alimentaires et autres. Coeurzilia espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Elle dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Coeurzilia is the coordinator of the "Tet Fret de Dumas" group. She lives in the Dumas region where electricity is rare and access to water very limited.

She has been running her business selling food products for the past 10 years.

She has repaid her previous loans and this is her 9th loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has bought items including flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

The other members and Coeurzilia are finishing their loans in the hopes of getting a new one. They are using this loan to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetic products, food products and other items.

Coeurzilia hopes that this loan will enable her to grow her business. She says that her main goal and dream is to own a large business thanks to her funds and the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: La Segesse De Bord-De-Mere Group

texts.fr:
Bossuet est le coordinateur de son groupe SEGESSE DE BORD-DE-MERE. Il habite dans la région de SEGESSE DE BORD-DE-MERE, d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant 6 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il était un professeur.

Bossuet voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans commerce et acheter divers produit avec cosmetiques (lotions pour le corps et les déodorants), chaussures, etc. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres La Segesse de Bor-de-Mer ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces. Bossuet dit que ses défis principal est deveniez une grande commerçant. Il dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède une gros business avec sa propre fond avec la mercy de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bossuet is the coordinator of the La Segesse De Bord-de-Mere group. He lives in the Segesse De Bord-de-Mere area of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is limited. 

Bossuet has been running a business where he sells various goods for six years. Before this, he was a teacher. 

He would like to use this loan to invest in his business and buy various products, such as cosmetics (body lotion and deodorant) and shoes. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.

The other members of the group need a loan for their various commercial businesses. 

Bossuet says that his main challenge is to become a large merchant. Meniau says that his main goal and his dream is to own a large business with enough funds with the mercy of God.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for several training videos for her NGO focused on women entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Roy's Group

texts.en: Roy’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Roy makes a living cultivating rice; she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: David

texts.es: DAVID: Es un señor sonriente y afable de 71 años de edad, casado con 7 hijos mayores de edad. Trabaja como conductor desde hace más de cuatro décadas.  Su esposa es ama de casa. Debido a que el techo se encuentra en mal estado, solicita financiamiento para comprar: zinc, clavos, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería.
texts.en: David is 71 years old, a friendly and smiling man. He is married, and has seven adult children. He has been working as a driver for more than four decades. His wife looks after the home. Due the fact that the roof is in poor condition, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy sheet metal roofing, nails, lumber, and cover labor costs. His dream is to set up a small general store.

loans.use: To repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Senhor Luís tem 29 anos de idade, é casado maritalmente, tem 3 filhos dos quais uma frequenta o ensino primário, é operador de máquinas, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de material eléctrico para meter energia na sua casa, e também vai comprar cimento, areia, pedra, para aumentar um quarto visto que a mesma só tem um cómodo.
No futuro sonha em terminar a construção da sua casa e mobilar como forma de dar conforto a sua família.
O seu desafio de terminar a divida sem entrar em moras como forma de garantir um bom histórico de empréstimo.
texts.en: Luis is 29 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends elementary school. He is a machine operator and lives in his own house. Other than his children, he has no other dependents. This loan will go toward buying electrical supplies so he can wire his house, and also toward cement, gravel, and stone so he can expand a bedroom. In the future he dreams of finishing the construction on his house and furnishing it so as to make his family more comfortable. His priority will be to pay off the loan without missing any payments so as to maintain a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies to wire his house, and also to buy cement, gravel, and stone.

loans.name: Cotzij Ya Group

texts.en:
The absolutely gorgeous Lake Atitlán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala has many small towns along its shores. San Pedro La Laguna is one of the towns on its shores where the Maya Tzutujil language is spoken.  

The Friendship Bridge “Cotzij Ya” group is located here with its eight members. These eight women are anxiously awaiting the opportunity of receiving a first loan from Friendship Bridge through the generosity of the Kiva lenders. The majority of these hardworking Tzutujil women make typical Mayan textiles, as well as preparing the typical food that the locals love to eat. 

Dolores is a member of “Cotzij ya.” She makes blouses and aprons In addition, she buys and sells typical wrap-around skirts (cortes) that are woven in beautiful colors. 

Dolores needs to increase her inventory and offer more variety to her customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more fabric. She wants to make aprons that are an important part of the typical outfit that the Maya women wear on a daily basis. She also wants to be able to buy fabric for the traditional wrap-around skirts (cortes) that the Mayan women buy to wear with their traditional aprons and blouses.  

Dolores is deeply motivated to see her business grow through a loan from Kiva lenders because she is committed to seeing her daughter graduate this year as a primary school teacher!

The eight women of “Cotzij ya” look forward to the non-formal education program of Friendship Bridge when they have training in subjects like women’s rights, women’s and children’s health issues, self-esteem, business management, and leadership. These are a few of the many topics presented by a facilitator at each monthly meeting. Dolores and her fellow members recognize the value of these monthly meetings as many of them have had little or no education. 

All the women in the Trust Bank are deeply grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing them with the opportunities to develop their lives, their businesses and their community. They send this message to Kiva lenders: “God bless you and thank you!!!”

loans.use: To buy fabric for the traditional wrap-around skirts (cortes) that the Mayan women wear

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
A sra Leonor tem 42 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais 01 é menor de idade e 02 estudam. Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00mts pretende comprar cebola, tomate, verduras, sabao e oleo da cozinha.
Ela sonha em ter uma mercearia, pois vende ao relento em que todos os dias, tem que desarrumar e levar os produtos para casa e vice-versa e, tem o desafio de rembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado.
texts.en: Leonor is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school and one is not yet school aged. With this loan of 15,000 MTS, she plans to buy onions, tomoatoes, vegetables, soap, and cooking oil. Her dream is to have a small grocery store, as she currentlly works as  mobile vendor which means she has to transport all her goods back and forth from her house every day. Her priority will be to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomoatoes, vegetables, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, stone, gravel, and rebar to build her house.

loans.name: Doris Magdalena

texts.es:
Doris tiene en su sangra el empuje y fuerza para trabajar, a sus 21 años, se siente con toda la energía del mundo.

Es padre de 1 hija menor de edad por la cual trabaja incansablemente para ofrecerle una vida digna.

Los ingresos los obtiene de su trabajo como porcicultora, pero este trabajo ha sido difícil por la competencia que se vive en las veredas del municipio de Valdivia.

Doris solicita humildemente un apoyo para poder comprar lechones, materiales para cochera y alimento para los mismo, de este forma intentara superar estas dificultades y tendrá un mejor capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Doris has the drive to work in her blood. At 21 years old, she has all the energy in the world. She is the mother of one minor child for whom she works tirelessly to provide a decent life. Her income comes from raising pigs, but this work has been difficult due to the competition that exists on the streets of the city of Valdivia. Doris humbly requests support to buy piglets, garage materials and food for her livestock. She wants to try to overcome these difficulties and have more capital for her business.

loans.use: buy piglets, garage materials and food.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en: Phen’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phen makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chayly's Group

texts.en: Chayly’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chayly makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en: Kong’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kong makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en: Khin’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Berlides Isabel

texts.es:
Berlides a sus 58 años de edad ve su sueño cumplirse, el cual es ser una persona independiente y competitiva en el mercado, gracias a la incursión de la Corporación Interactuar en su vida, pudo lograr este sueño y montó una cría y venta de pollos en un corral de su casa. 

Por lo que hoy solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de gallinas ponedoras y pollos para la cría, además de alimento para los mismos. Es madre de 3 hijos a los que sueña poder pagarles una buena educación. 

Berlides como buena madre siempre estará a su lado apoyándolos incondicionalmente, por eso esta tan determinado en triunfar en este nuevo proceso de su vida.
texts.en:
At 58 years of age, Berlides has seen her dream come true, which is to be independent and competitive in the market. Thanks to the introduction in her life of Kiva partner Corporación Interactuar (the "Interact Corporation"), she could achieve this dream and set up chicken breeding and sales from her home.

Today she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of laying hens and chickens to raise, as well as chicken feed. She is the mother of three children for whom she dreams of providing a good education. As a good mother, Berlides is always at their side to support them unconditionally, and this is why she is so determined to succeed in this new stage of her life.

loans.use: purchase laying hens and chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Ngern's Group

texts.en: Ngern’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ngern makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Leoung's Group

texts.en: Leoung’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Leoung makes a living cultivating rice and selling fish, and also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en: The members of Samart’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Samart makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Reoun's Group

texts.en: Reoun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Reoun makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children. She works very hard to provide for family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Catherine has been in this business for 13 years and her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Om's Group

texts.en: Om’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom, a province in Cambodia. Om makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is not reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Om's group to safeguard the health of their families.  Additionally, the filter will save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chengney's Group

texts.en: Chengney’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom, a province in Cambodia. Chengney makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In her village, there is not reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of Chengney's group to safeguard the health of her family.  Additionally, they will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 47-year-old married woman living in Zarqa, who sews clothes and dresses. Eight years ago, she decided to add a new field in order to improve her standard of living and so she started making few pieces of tapestry and handcrafts in her house to sell. She wants to help her husband with the household expenses and to live a comfortable life with him, as well as supporting her adopted daughter and providing her with a good life and good education. She is asking for the loan to buy more craft products to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy thread and sewing tools.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en: Claudina lives in Atsabe.  She makes most of her daily income from her business, which she started in 2012 using her own working capital of $500.  Tuba Rai Metin offered an $800 loan to Claudina to help her buy additional supplies for her kiosk, such as cooking oils, aqua, hand body, cigarettes, soy sauce, and other items that people like.  She is happy with the loan that allows her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, aqua, hand body, cigarettes, soy sauce and other things to sell.

loans.name: Luaono

texts.en:
Luaono is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Luaono has requested a loan to buy oil, frying pans, bananas, plastic paper, etc. 

She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Luaono will use her profit to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy oil, frying pans, plastic paper and bananas.

loans.name: Hector Fabio

texts.es:
Hector es un hombre de 37 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados, materiales para construcción de una cochera para albergar estos animales, con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya con un préstamo a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
37-year old Hector is a loving father who earns his living as a farmer. He doesn't earn enough to cover household expenses so he has begun another job in his spare time. So now as well as being a laborer on other farms, he raises and sells pigs in an effort to improve his family's standard of living. As head of the family Hector is responsible for all household expenses which doesn't leave much for him to invest in his business.

For this reason he is seeking a loan to buy pigs and feed, plus building materials so he can construct a pen in which to keep the pigs. Then Hector will be able to increase sales and improve his business--its improved appearance will attract more customers, and he will have more pigs to sell.

Hector's biggest dream is to earn enough money so he doesn't have to deny his family any of the necessities of life. That is something that he experienced and it affected him greatly. And that is why he now works so hard to support his wife and children.

Please help Hector, a citizen of Colombia, achieve his dreams!

loans.use: Buy pigs, feed and materials to build a pen for them

loans.name: Kha Lout Tayar Village Group 3

texts.en:
The loan will help a group of 30 members. The featured borrower, Kyi, is 56 years old and married with a son. She and her husband farm 30 acres of crop farm. Kyi sometimes sells vegetables and fruits at the market for additional income. This loan will help the family to purchase fertilizers and pay for hired labor during harvest time. Kyi hopes to see improvements in the farm this year compared to last year's outcomes, so that they will have better regulation of cash flow. As parents, they aim for their son to be well educated and have a better future. 

Pictured above are the CBO leaders from Kha Lout Tayar Village Group 3, named: Kyi, Nyein, Kay, Thawe and Soe. They oversee 30 group members altogether. The loan from Proximity Designs will help them purchase crop seeds, fertilizers and gases for cropping machines. 

Kha Lout Tayar Village is located in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River at Delta Region and they mainly focus on crop farming. They also plant betel leaves and seasonal foods for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds, and pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando.
 
Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Nancy también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very hardworking, responsible woman who has had to overcome many problems in her life. However, she has always found the strength to carry on and make progress. A short while ago she started a business selling eggs. She has a number of chickens which ensures that she always has eggs to sell.

Her dream is to see her business grow and she knows that with help from Corporación Interactuar and the people who support it, she will succeed. 

For this reason Nancy is seeking a loan to buy more chickens so she can increase egg production and satisfy her customers' orders. Sales will increase considerably, and her business will get a shot in the arm.

Nancy also wishes to have a large business one day and use all her business training to make it a success.

loans.use: buy chickens and increase egg production so she can satisfy her customers' orders

loans.name: Maria Romelia

texts.es:
Maria ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo productos de uso personal a través de catálogos de distintas marcas, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para sus hijos.
Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de perfumería, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros al por mayor para tener mejor inventario.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Maria has had to face a lot of adversity in the process of developing her business. 

She presently lives in a humble home and makes a living selling personal products via catalogs of different brands. She learned how to do this empirically, in the hurry to obtain the necessary livelihood for her children.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of perfumes, creams and cosmetics amongst others at wholesale prices in order to have better inventory. 

The loan will allow her to offer her products and improve her sales in a considerable manner.

She is a strong woman and has an extremely entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics amongst others at wholesale pricing in order to have better inventory.

loans.name: Yhem's Group

texts.en: Yhem’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yhem has two children and works as a farmer to support her family.  In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencilla, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

Ella tiene un cultivo de plátano el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a las campesinas trabajadoras de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a una humilde agricultora para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Consuelo is a woman with a lot of experience in the field. She is humble and simple, she has a way with people and enough energy to make any crop produce. 

She has a plantain crop which she tends to every day in order to sell her harvest in the Valencia municipality's market plaza. 

Thanks to her years of experience and the teachings she learned from her father as a child, she is fully capable of working and advising the other farmers in the area on the subject when they need help with their production. 

She requests the loan to purchase agricultural materials such as fertilizers, plantain seeds and pesticides. This way she will be injecting capital into her activity and improving her harvests in a significant manner. She will be up against her biggest difficulty which is the variable climate that affects her harvest. 
 
She has a lot of faith in her business and hopeful expectations for the supportive people who help the women farmers working in Colombia like the Interactuar corporation does. 

Support a humble farmer with a loan so she is able to succeed in working her lands.

loans.use: purchase agricultural materials such as fertilizers, plantain seeds and pesticides. This way she will be injecting capital into her activity and improving her harvests.

loans.name: Meak's Group

texts.en: Meak’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Meak makes a living cultivating rice and does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Reat's Group

texts.en: Reat’s Group members live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Reat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by no longer collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
A (USD) $800 loan for Olga would improve her business. Olga opened her kiosk in 2014 through her own hard work. She will use the loan to buy stock for her business such as gasoline and diesel fuel..Olga is generating a good income from her business.
She has been thinking of running a bigger business after years of gaining experience in business..Olga is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy gasolinel and diesel fuel

loans.name: Legalo

texts.en: Legalo is a 34-year-old married mother of two children. She runs a small business selling rice, curry, and chicken in her community and has been doing this for four years. Legalo has requested a loan to buy rice, salt, chicken, curry, and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Legalo hopes to raise her family's living standard and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, cooking oil, and curry.

loans.name: Cosmenia

texts.en:
Cosmenia is a married, 57-year-old mother of 12 children, two in school.

Cosmenia is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cosmenia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Cosmenia has been farming for 13 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business..

In the future, Cosmenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is a 64-year-old married mother and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nelyn has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Nelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Nelyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Nelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jose Urias

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda es el gran sueño de Jose, que con su trabajo de mantenimiento de ventiladores ha intentado superar sus dificultades financieras.

Trabaja en un pequeño espacio en su casa de manera muy humilde y sencilla, pero con gran voluntad y empeño.

Solicita un préstamo, pues desea comprar repuestos para la reparación de ventiladores.

Este negocio le dará el sustento que necesitan el su familia, es por eso que la invitación es a que lo ayuden prestándole a su negocio soñado.
texts.en:
Improving the conditions of his home is Jose's biggest dream, who, through his work with fan repairs, has tried to overcome his financial difficulties. 

He works in a small space in his home in a very humble and simple manner, but with great determination and effort. 

He requests a loan because he wants to purchase spare parts for the repairing of fans. 

This business will provide the livelihood that his family needs, this is why you are invited to help him by lending to his dream business.

loans.use: purchase spare parts for repairing fans.

loans.name: Ediana

texts.en: This loan of (USD) $1,000 will allow Ediana to send her youngest daughter to post-secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies. Ediana loves her daughter very much and hopes that her further education will help her to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con su hijo y su esposa en una humilde finca en zona rural de Caparrapi. 

El se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una marrana de cría, ampliación de corral, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

El sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Oscar is an energetic and dedicated man who lives in a simple farmhouse with his wife and son in the rural area of Caparrapi. For the last year he has earned his living raising pigs; this job provides him with enough money to support his family.

Oscar works every day as the pigs have to be cleaned out, fed, and regularly checked to ensure correct development before they can be sold.

He is seeking a loan to buy another pig to raise, to expand the pig pen, and to buy feed. These purchases will enable him to raise better-fed pigs in better conditions.

His dream is to see his children get good jobs and be as well-educated as possible.

loans.use: buy another pig to raise, to expand the pig pen, and to buy feed.

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Fresitas” está conformado por seis personas responsables con distintas actividades comerciales una de ellas es la Sra Liz de 33 años de edad soltera  con una pequeña hija que aun estudia en la escuela. Hace dos años ella implemento su peluquería en un local alquilado ubicado en un lugar céntrico en cual ofrece cortes de cabello para damas caballeros y niños tintes y ondulaciones. Con el ingreso de sus ventas ella solventa los gastos de su pequeña hija, el mayor anhelo de Liz es ampliar e implementar su peluquería. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tintes de cabello, oxigenta y algunos accesorios de belleza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Liz es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho viste blusa rosada.
texts.en:
The "Las Fresitas" group comprises six responsible members, who engage in different business activities.

Liz is one of the members. She is 33 years old, is single, and has a young daughter, who is still in school. 

Two years ago, she rented a centrally located premises where she set up a beauty salon. The services she offers include hair colouring, perms, and haircuts for women, men, and children. 

With the profits from her work, she covers her daughter's expenses. Liz's greatest desire is to expand and improve her beauty salon.

She will use the loan to buy hair dyes, Oxigenta lotion (a product for hair colouring) and some beauty accessories. 

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan.

In the photo, Liz is the first person sitting on the right side. She is wearing a pink blouse.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, Oxigenta lotion, and other items.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old and married with four children, two in school. Susana works very hard to provide for her family.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susana has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aksanti Mungu Group

texts.fr: Dans le souci de nourrir sa famille, Yusia s'est lancé dans la culture du riz en 1995 aidé par ses parents. Le riz était l'aliment de base dans les villages, cela en est le cas même aujourdhui pour ses enfants. Du fait qu'il y a insuffisance de récolte, il compte, grâce aux crédits qu'il aura à bénéficier régulièrement, améliorer ses techniques culturales, diversifier la semence et produire avec un haut rendement les jours à venir. Cela aura un impact remarquable sur l'éducation de ses fils et sur leur avenir. Il préside le groupe AKSANTI MUNGU et sur photo, il porte un chapeau rouge.
texts.en: In the concern of feeding his family, Yusia started farming rice in 1995 with the help of his parents. Rice used to be the staple food in the villages, which is still the case today for his children. Because there is an insufficiency in harvest, he plans to, thanks to the loans he will be able to take advantage of regularly, to improve his farming techniques, diversify the seeds, and produce at high yield in the near future. This will have a noticeable impact on his sons’ education and future. He presides over the AKSANTI MUNGU group and in the photo, he is wearing a red hat.

loans.use: to pay for hoeing, seeds and phytosanitary products, and to pay for labor at harvest

loans.name: Mauricio Alberto

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Mauricio es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesta a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.

El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera con su respectiva cria, que le den un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Working out on the land is one of the most difficult jobs these days because of the large effort needed to make progress, but Mauricio is a man who has never given up in spite of whatever weather or circumstances arise, he is always determined to obtain resources for his family.  

He gets up first thing in the morning to travel to various farms in order to fulfil his work commitments.  He alternates this with selling milk that he gets from his own cows. 

He wishes to increase his working capital to guarantee the sustainability of his business, and it is this reason that brought him to request a loan to invest in the purchase of a cow and its calf, which will give a large boost to his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and its calf, which will give a large boost to his business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminias lives in Atsabe. She has been involved in business activities since 2007. She started with her own working capital of (USD) $1,000. She is a business women and her husband works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan of (USD) $1,000 from Tuba rai Metin to improve her business. She is very interested in her business and will use this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more items such as slippers, toothpaste, sugar, salt cooking oils, hand body, cigarettes, sardines, milk, noodles, shampoo, and hard drinks. She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and hopes to open a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To buy slippers, toothpaste, sugar, salt cooking oils, hand body, cigarettes, sardines, milk, noodles, shampoo, and hard drinks.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo se dedica  a la costura para poder solventar sus estudios Universitario, vive con sus padres, a la vez que trabaja estudia para ser técnico en enfermería.
 Sus metas son que cuando se reciba pueda crecer como persona y profesional y darle una mejor calidad a su vida y brindarles una ayuda a sus padres.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir parte de sus gastos de titulación y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Rodrigo does sewing in order to pay for his university studies. He lives with his parents and he works while he studies for a degree in Nursing.

When he receives his degree, his goals include growing as a person and as a professional. He also wants to help his parents and provide them a better quality of life.

Rodrigo is requesting this loan so that he can cover part of his degree expenses since these are currently outstanding.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: Auleen

texts.en: Auleen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old, and four of her children are in school. Auleen has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business. Auleen has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en: Flordeluna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flordeluna is 49 years old and has two children who are in school. Flordeluna has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Flordeluna applied for a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber (a kind of hemp) and other materials that she needs. Flordeluna has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Flordeluna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber (a kind of hemp) and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Mirian Janeth

texts.es: Mirian tiene 28 años de edad es soltera tiene 1 hija vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza Visote, Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, papas, tomate, y a la cria de chanchos, solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para engordarles y para el polvillo, gracias al crédito podra mejorar su negocio, su meta es mejorar su calidad de vida, en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer y pasar con la hijita.
texts.en:
Mirian is 28 years old, single, and has a daughter. She lives with her parents in the community of Nueva Esperanza Visote in Guaranda, which is in Bolivar Province. Mirian is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, and tomatoes. She also raises pigs.

Mirian is requesting a loan in order to buy animals to fatten and for producing leather. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her business. Her goal is to improve her quality of life.

In her free time, Mirian enjoys weaving and being with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 37 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years, 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested his maize.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine aged 34 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 6 years. 1 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en: Iuliana is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, chicken legs, sugar and flour. She has been doing this for two years. Iuliana needs a loan to buy such items as bags of flour, rice and sugar, a box of chicken legs and a box of canned fish. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, a box of chicken legs, a box of canned fish and other items to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking mother from Polo, Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and is a businesswoman who sells and delivers fish. She buys fish from their fishermen neighbors, as well as travels to buy fishes from neighboring towns.

Helen has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to accumulate cocoland as her additional property.

Helen hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to accumulate cocoland.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julieta is 50 years old, and her children who are in school. Julieta has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Julieta applied for a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber (a kind of hemp) and other materials she needs. Julieta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber (a kind of hemp) and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and she applied for a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of fruits, spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, such as fattening pigs. Regina dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits, spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Manuela is 39 years old, and three of her children are currently in school. Manuela has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Manuela applied for a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Manuela has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Manuela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 14 years. She earns additional income from farming coconuts.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Thacien

texts.en:
Thacien is 66 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 15 and 28 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been farming for the past 2 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay the workers who cultivated his maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions.
