texts.en: Gulnora is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is a widow and has two children.  She is a talented, responsible and honest person. She is a tailor. She sews traditional women's dresses with her daughter. Her business is doing well, but it is not enough to provide for her children. She tries her best to work hard and feed her family. She thought and came up with the idea to do a business at home, keeping livestock and feeding them for further selling. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to buy livestock and do the business. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy livestock and do business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Rebecca dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ana Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her restaurant. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery .

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano is a native from Loon, Bohol. He is a 58-year-old married man with five children.  He raises and sells hogs to support his family. He needs funds to support his current source of income.

 He has requested a loan to purchase feeds, piglets, and vitamins. These are very essential to the improvement of his hog raising business. With these, he will be able to raise and sell quality hogs, thus enabling him to expand his existing business and be able to explore any possible business ventures.

In the future, Cayetano is determined to handle his hog raising business to make a sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, piglets, and vitamins

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason for Nenita’s perseverance. Wanting to give them abundant life in the future, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store business. She dreams that all her children will finish schooling because she knows that it’s the first step to their success.

Nenita and her three children reside in Caloocan City. Her husband, Nelson, is working as welder abroad. It’s challenging for Nenita to raise her children while her husband is away, but the whole family is sacrificing just to earn enough money to support their growing expenses. Nenita wants to improve her business so that her husband can stop working abroad and just be with them. One way to improve it is to acquire an additional capital of PHP 34,000 to procure grocery items at wholesale prices so she can gain more profit. It can boost her income and savings. The time will come when she will own a big grocery store and her husband can just work in the Philippines. 

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. You can also be an instrument to reunite a family. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. Nenita meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to procure grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Romenia

texts.en: Romenia lives in Dili where she is a businesswoman. She has been doing this business since 2012 with her own working capital of $1,000. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, soy, eggs, candy, aqua, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, soy, eggs, candy, aqua, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 28 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Richelle is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets to raise and sell.

Richelle has been pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
You're indeed a great blessing to Lolita! She is so thankful that you have extended your helping hands to her. Because of the previous loan that you lent to her, she was able to purchase more items for her business. She was also able to provide for the household through the income she got. 

She would like to take out again a loan worth PHP 20,000. She would prefer to use this to buy additional quantities of brooms that she sells. It would really mean a lot to her if you'd allow her request, especially since she wants to save money for a better living condition for her family.

She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy brooms to resell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 55 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, cereals, etc., to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, cereals, etc. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ivani Maria

texts.es:
Ivani, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para sus 3 hijos, inicio con un negocio de barbería prestando su servicio en su casas o a domicilio en el municipio de Medellin, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitado por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de una vitrina en la que podrá exhibir productos capilares de una mejor manera.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Ivani a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
In her tireless search of a better life and better economic stability for her 3 children, Ivani started a barbershop. She offers her services in her home or by making house calls in the municipality of Medellin, where drive and determination are very important benchmarks for the residents of this zone.

She works every day at a very varied schedule and is always busy with some form of service since she is much sought after for her good work.

Ivani is asking for economic assistance so that she can purchase a display case in which she will be able to better exhibit hair products.

She presently feels happy for the good job that she has done up until now and that has allowed her to enjoy a more stable job.

With a loan, you can help support Ivani in continuing with her life project!

loans.use: to buy a display case in which she will be able to better exhibit hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material and wooden frames for knitting embroidered dresses to sell

loans.name: Soukayna

texts.en: Soukayna is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, who are attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her beloved family and her husband is the main income source in family. He owns a supermarket in his town. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees. She insists that she will be a permanent customer as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for her children in an agreeable environment.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl, 26 years old, is from Alegria, Cebu. She is married with two children who are five and seven years old. Her husband is a fisherman and Cheryl helps by selling his catch. Also, sometimes she will buy fresh fish from other fishermen and sell it for a profit. She has been in this business for five years, earning on average PHP 4,000 per month. She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more fresh fish to sell. In the future, she dreams of living an abundant life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a dedicated member of CCT Credit Cooperative for many years, Erlinda gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and business. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family, and her community in Caloocan City by being a warm and supportive colleague. 

Erlinda is a loving wife to her husband Marcelito, a driver, and a caring mother to their child. Her husband’s income as driver is irregular, so Erlinda tries to earn extra money by running an auto repair shop. It's advantageous for her because her husband's fellow drivers are her usual customers. 

However, the price of spare parts is quite high, and some of her customers don’t pay on time. Erlinda needs extra capital amounting to PHP 32,000 to buy spare parts for her shop. It will sustain her business despite many debts. Your help will be of great help to her and you may be assured that she knows how to use it wisely. 

Aside from their auto repair shop, Erlinda's husband also drives their public utility jeepney which is another source of income for the family (Erlinda is shown in picture with their jeepney).

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her auto repair shop

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata has been involved in activities since 2010. She started her business with her own working capital of $400. Liberata is a business woman, and she is very interested in her business, so she is busy every day with her business. 

Liberata  has a kiosk in her house, so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies for customers, including slippers, eggs, biscuits, cigarettes, water ice, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell. 

With this loan, her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy slippers, eggs, biscuits, cigarettes, water ice, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: A loan of $1,000 will help Genoveva to send her daughter to secondary school. She hopes that by continuing her daughter’s education, she will have more opportunities and a better life. The money will be used to cover educational costs including tuition, books, school supplies, and registration.

loans.use: to buy tuition, books, school supplies, and registration.

loans.name: Yazmin Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yazmin, intenta ganarse la vida con la venta de golosinas, dulces, obleas, entre otros. Con estos alimentos intenta salir adelante día a día.

Vive en con sus tres hijos y su esposo en su casa el cual la apoya en su pequeño negocio.

Con esta actividad ha sobrevivido durante 17 años, y a pesar de los pocos ingresos y lo difícil de su vida, nunca deja su alegría y sonrisa.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de surtido de confites, dulces, insumos para sus obleas, entre otros.

Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de abastecerse y tener su negocio un poco mas consolidado.
texts.en:
Yazmin is trying to make a living selling sweets, candies, wafers, among others. With this food, she tries to get ahead day to day. 
She lives with her three children and her husband in their house, and he helps her in her small business. 
With this occupation she has survived for 17 years, and in spite of the low income and how difficult her life is, she is always happy and smiling. 

She is asking for economic help to make a purchase of a supply of sweets, candies, ingredients for her wafers, among others. 
This loan will give her the opportunity to have a supply and have a more consolidated business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of sweets, candies, and ingredients for her wafers, among others.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmencita is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Carmencita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. She works as a tailor to provide support to her husband. She has a good reputation in her town and earns barely enough income. Today she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees. She intends to provide him with a good education and ensure that he has a secure future.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 49 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Rowena has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from meat processing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia works hard to support his family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Arsenia has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es:
Comprar vivienda y tener un negocio sostenible son los grandes sueños de Jose, que con su chaza de snacks intenta ganarse la vida día a día.

Trabaja en este pequeño negocio durante 10 horas al día con la esperanza de poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de sus hijos.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar inventario de golosinas y snacks, los cuales son productos muy consumidos en el municipio de Itagui.
texts.en:
Jose's two big dreams are to buy a house and have a sustainable business. Through his snack shop, he tries to make a living day by day.

He works in this little business for 10 hours a day, in hopes of being able to earn the necessary income to support his children.

He is requesting economic support to buy a stock of sweets and snacks, which are very highly consumed products in the city of Itagui.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sweets and snacks, which are very popular products in Itagui

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children. She is a housewife and her husband works as an employee in a company. He is the main income provider in order to fulfill their family needs. She also benefits from her children's expenses. But because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. This is the third time that she has requested Kiva’s support to pay the school fees. She is very happy because she will be able to register her children with the school.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salome is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Salome requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing net to use for fishing.

Salome has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Salome would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net to use for fishing

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old, married, and has five children. 

Aida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Aida has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer trabajadora, organizada y perseverante, dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. 

Desde hace 17 años es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocido por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando mecato, dulces, chocolatinas, galletería, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Rosa manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking, organized, and persevering woman, dedicated to her family and passionate about her work.

For the past 17 years she has been an independent saleswoman. She has a store located in the city center. She works there every day for 12 hours. She has the advantage of not having a lot of competition, so she is already well-known among the various citizens who have become her main customers.

With the support of the loan, she will strengthen her inventory, buying cakes, sweets, chocolate bars, and cookies. This will enable her to have more variety available to offer her customers, and therefore increase her sales.

Rosa declares that her greatest desire is to continue strengthening and gaining recognition for her business. Then she would be guaranteed greater profitability and have the economic capacity to improve the condition of her house, where she could enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her family.

loans.use: to buy cakes, sweets, chocolate bars, and cookies

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including candy, cooking oils, noodles, aqua, biscuits, eggs, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2011 with her own working capital of $1,000.00. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to have good management and to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She hopes that her business can be successful.

loans.use: To buy candy, cooking oils, noodles, aqua, biscuits, eggs, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio José es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Antonio José, soy de Tamayo pero resido en Barahona. Tengo 18 años y vivo con mis padres. Soy el segundo de mis hermanos, mi papá trabaja en el Ministerio de Agricultura y mi mamá vende ropa interior. 

Quiero estudiar medicina en la Universidad Central del Este, para así ayudar a los enfermos necesitados de mi país en especial de mi comunidad. 
 
Mi familia no tiene los recursos suficientes para costear el alto costo de la matrícula en la UCE. Solo pueden ayudarme con el alojamiento y sostenimiento mientras estudio. Por lo que requiero del préstamo de KIVA para poder lograr mi sueño de ser excelente médico. 

De aprobarme el préstamo me esforzaré en terminar mi carrera en el tiempo establecido, con buenas calificaciones para así quedarles bien a ustedes.
texts.en:
Antonio Jose is a young man who is studying medicine. He is asking for a loan to be able to cover his higher education expenses. 
This is his story: My name is Antonio Jose, I am from Tamayo, but I live in Barahona. I am 18 years old and I live with my parents. I am the second of my brothers, my father works in the Ministry of Agriculture and my mother sells undergarments. I want to study medicine in the Central University of the East, so I can help sick people who are in need in my country, especially in my community. My family does not have sufficient resources to afford the high cost of tuition in the UCE. They can only help me with room and board while I study. This is why I need a KIVA loan to be able to achieve my dream of being an excellent doctor. If the loan is approved, I will work very hard to finish my degree in the established time, with good grades so I can stay in your good graces.

loans.use: to cover his higher education expenses.

loans.name: Aslbi

texts.en:
Aslbi is an honest woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a policeman. Aslbi is a generous, hardworking, and gentle person.

Aslbi is a seller. She does a business of buying and selling kids’ wear. She has a practice of trading and knows well how to serve customers. She needs to enlarge her business in order to help her husband to ensure their family.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy kids’ clothing. She is willing to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders’ compassion.

loans.use: to buy kids' clothing.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like edible oil, sugar, noodles, biscuits, canned goods, powdered soap, shampoo, seasonings, beverages and assorted drinks. In addition to that, she also provides cellphone loads to customers who are smart subscribers. 

She is a 37-year-old married woman with two dependents who are 12 and 10 years old. She has been operating a sari-sari store for eight years now. To fill her store again, she has requested a loan.

She has requested a loan in the amount  of 18,000 PHP to buy stock like soft drinks, assorted groceries, liquor, and cellphone load. With the presence of these resources, her store will be full of stock again. In this way, it could attract more customers and help to improve the family's daily income.
 
She dreams of expanding her livelihood and to also support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy stock like soft drinks, assorted groceries, liquor, and cellphone load

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda. She wants to request another loan, this time for PHP 20,000, to continue the operations of her business. 

She knows that you are the right people to ask because she has proven once that you're reliable. She has a lot of hope for this since it has always been her dream to widen the range of her business. That's why she's really eager to work diligently. 

She will use this amount to purchase supplies of raw ingredients for her homemade peanut butter that she sells within her community. Today, this is the her only source of income. It depends on you whether she continues managing this. Now is your time to help a mother like her. 

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina, en su humilde hogar, intenta tener una vida digna y un mejor futuro, es por eso que se dedica a la venta de frituras y snacks en una chaza en el municipio de Frontino.

Con esta actividad ha intentado salir adelante durante 4 años.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de surtido de confites, dulces, entre otros.

Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de abastecerse y tener su negocio un poco mas consolidado.
texts.en:
In her humble home, Lina tries to have a respectable life and a better future. For this reason, she works selling fried foods and snacks in a food stall in the municipality of Frontino.

For the past four years, she has tried to get ahead with this business.

She is requesting economic support to purchase a stock of candies, sweets, etc.

This loan will give her the opportunity to stock her store and make her business a little stronger.

loans.use: to stock up on candies, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly works hard to support her family. Shirly is married and has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy cashew nuts to sell.

Shirly has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Shirly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 48-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown.

He has been using a four-wheeled manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventory to run his shop in a good manner.

His children are growing, and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills, and household expenses, he wants to establish his business, but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy initial stock (fresh and seasonal vegetables) for her husband's green grocery shop.

loans.name: Amelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amelia, de 59 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fabricas donde trabajaba como operaria de maquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

Ella se dedica a su negocio todos los días durante 5 horas con 1 empleado.

Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de una maquina filetadora.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Fifty-nine year old Amelia has extensive experience in the clothing sector, thanks to her many jobs in different factories where she worked as a sewing machine operator.

Today she is an independent woman and makes her own income through making clothing for third parties and with her own small clothing line.

She is a very enterprising woman and her greatest motivation to work is her children who sometimes help her in her business. She works in her business every day for five hours with one employee. 

She has many projects that she wants to complete to the extent possible, but for this she needs the help of financial aid which will allow her to invest capital in her business through the purchase of a threading machine. 

With this loan she will be able to keep her business current and continue offering employment to people in the sector.

loans.use: to purchase a threading machine.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans et  vit à Tokoin pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Akossiwa  fait des soins de beauté dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Akossiwa  s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Akossiwa  sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des vernis et des produits de beauté pour améliorer sa prestation et faire une bonne rentabilité afin de soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 37-year old married woman who lives and works in Tokoin. In order to support her family, Akossiwa earns a living by providing beauty services as an itinerant beautician. She buys her supplies once a month at the market. 

With the goal of replenishing her stock, Akossiwa is seeking this loan to buy nail polish and beauty products so as to expand her selection and earn a good revenue. In this way she will help her husband provide for everyday family needs.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozens of nail polish and 10 packs of artificial nails.

loans.name: Ludys Consuelo

texts.es:
Ludys es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica de 50 años de edad, comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 4 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares y amigos, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor de acolchados, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 7 horas.

Ludys tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Ludys is an enterprising and dynamic woman of 50 years old. She is an independent merchant. Four years ago she started selling merchandise to her family and friends, in order to generate income to contribute to the economy of her home.

The loan that she requests is for support to strengthen her business. She will invest the money in the purchase of an assortment of quilts wholesale, providing greater selection and a better service to her customers, and making her business more profitable. She works alone every day for 7 hours.

Ludys has the firm intention to take forward her productive project. She wants to become a successful businesswoman and ensure a better quality of life and welfare for her family. She knows that with help from Kiva lenders and Interactuar she can achieve all that and more.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of quilts wholesale.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.

Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 18 años cuando decidió abrir su negocio de venta de almuerzos en el municipio de Medellín.

En su negocio ofrece alimentos variados, los cuales son muy apetecidos por los clientes que visitan regularmente su negocio.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de utensilios de cocina para mejorar la productividad a la hora de preparar estos alimentos.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
For Luz, the only thing that she has in mind at the moment is that to be able to succeed, she has to work hard and always stay strong through all of the adversities that may arise.

For this reason, every day she works in a firm manner. But she doesn't put aside her big smile and charisma that have allowed her earn her place for the past 18 years, since she decided to open her business selling lunches in the city of Medellín.

In her business, she offers various lunches, which are highly sought after by the customers who regularly visit her business.

She is asking for financial support for the purchase of kitchen utensils, to improve her productivity when preparing these foods.

She knows that together with "Interactuar" and with the help of Kiva lenders, she can have a very reputable business with the best stability possible.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils to improve her productivity when she is preparing food.

loans.name: Fanny Yanet

texts.es:
Fanny es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 37 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 2 empleos directos; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de guías e insumos para la confección, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Fanny sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Fanny is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur. Her field of work is dressmaking, offering third-party services.

Everything began some months ago when she was working as a production worker in a sewing workshop. Now, at the age of 37, she already has her own workshop, in which she generates two direct employment positions. She works every day, and her strength is making pants and shirts for uniforms. In this way, she generates sufficient resources to help her husband with the economic responsibilities of the household.

The loan that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of sewing guides and supplies for sewing. Thus she will be able to meet the requests of her customers and deliver the orders in a timely manner, with the goal of increasing production and acquiring new contracts that will allow her to give continuity to her micro-business.

Fanny dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and have a greater level of production every day in order to generate new employment opportunities and improve the quality of life of her family as well as that of the people who have a daily effect on her work.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sewing guides and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina se dedica a la venta de productos de bisutería, productos que son muy bien acogidos por los habitantes del municipio de Bello.
Es casada y madre de una bebe de 10 meses (Ver Foto) con gran satisfacción y amor por su familia y su trabajo, pues este le ha dado lo necesario para vivir.

Solicita un aliento económico el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de productos de bisutería.

 Con este préstamo podrá sacar adelante su empresa y podría convertirse en una gran empresaria a futuro.
texts.en:
Catalina sells articles of costume jewelry, articles which enjoy a very good reception among the inhabitants of the town of Bello.

She is married and the mother of a 10-month old baby girl (see photo), with great fulfilment and love from her family and her work, since this latter has given her the necessities of life.

She is applying for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of supplies for the manufacture of articles of costume jewelry.

With this loan she will be able to move her company forward and she could become a great businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: buy supplies for the manufacture of articles of costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 51 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Cesaria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, etc. She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as the above. 

Cesaria would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is 32 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Gaza. To increase the family income, she started work sewing at home five years ago. 

Amani is one of those people affected by the last war in Gaza as her house was destroyed. She would like to repair it again, and for this reason she has requested a loan to purchase cement and other building materials, including house paint. 

Amani is very grateful to everyone who helps her. She hopes to be able to go back to her normal life again with her family, and to provide good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials, including house paint.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 34 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Jocelyn has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain the tractor and trolley for her husband's construction supplying business.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Imagine how small things can change lives!

It was recently that Flordeliz was granted a loan that helped her a lot in establishing her sari-sari store business. Through your small act of help, she was able to supply her small store with more grocery stock, resulting in a higher gain of income salary.

Pushing towards the goal to further improve what she has started, she would like to ask again for your sympathy as she takes out a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 that she would utilize for the same purpose--to buy additional stock of grocery items to sell and other stuffs.

Surely, this will bring joy and gladness to her since she sees this opportunity as a milestone to success. Even though at times she faces and walks the narrow roads of life, she doesn't lose hope and continues to persevere for her family, especially for the education of her kids.

To further strengthen this kind of faith, she attends faithfully a weekly gathering of her colleagues and they study the word of God and share their life stories, where they find the hope to continue the race.

You are a big part of her milestone! And you don't waste this chance to help her reach progress eventually!

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
 
Lucy has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a married man aged 28 years. He lives in a rural area with his wife. He deals in agriculture, specifically growing passion fruits and pineapples. He works six days a week, and each day he works for 10 hours.

He started his business in 2005 with the aim of earning a living since he dropped out of school at a tender age. He is acquiring this loan in order to buy fertilizers for spreading in his passion fruit plantation in order to boost his yields.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns, and his dream is to be the leading producer of passion fruits. His biggest challenges are lack of enough capital and unpredictable weather changes. He works so hard to overcome these challenges. He appreciates the lending hand extended to him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Aini

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! 

This is Aini, one of Ruma’s agents. Aini lives in Semarang, the capital of Central Java, 9 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Aini is happily married and, together with her husband, they have two cute sons. She owns a very small stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. 

As the business grows, Aini is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. This is important to her because your loan will really help her to improve her business and her community, who need access to such services. 

In the near future, Aini's goal in regard to Ruma is to serve her community as an e-commerce business, which is part of Ruma's latest product called Mapan. Through Mapan, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Aini is the one shown in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her local community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of three who is doing mixed farming for a living. She is a great salesperson when it comes to selling agricultural produce. This skill led her to start cereal trading in order to boost her income. As a cereal trader, Mary helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. With over 20 years of experience in the farming business, she leverages the strong relationships she has built with various actors in the value chain.

Mary is seeking a loan to buy more cereals. Given that she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, your loan will help her secure a huge stock that she can sell in other markets where prices are competitive.

Your loan investment in Mary will not only help her family get a better income, but also help other farmers to sell their produce at competitive market prices.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna started selling ready-to-wear clothes eight years ago. For this long, her family's everyday survival has depended on this. Though it was up and down, she really strives hard to prove that poverty is never a hindrance. It just takes a little perseverance to get it along the way.

Previously, she was granted a loan that enabled her to develop her inventory. Today, she would like to avail herself again of a loan that she would use to buy additional ready-to-wear products for her store. It would be an wide open opportunity for her to increase her profit and then eventually save for her family needs.

She is very positive that you will respond to her request and grant her the loan because she knows that there are still people like you who are willing to help.

She prays that some day she will be blessed with more so that she can bless others in return. She also aspires for her kids to graduate, get their degrees and work as professionals.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear products for her store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Teresa has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials .

Teresa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
For almost 10 years, Aurelia has been managing her direct-selling business. Here, she sells different kinds of personal products like lotions, cosmetics, perfumes and other related products. By selling such items, she makes a living for her family--food and other basic necessities.

In fact, to further improve her business sales, she had a loan from Kiva previously that she utilized to purchase more products to sell. This was actually a great help. Although sometimes it is inevitable to experience hardships, especially in business matters, Aurelia still continues.

Today, she would like to request again a PHP 10,000 loan. She needs support because she wants to buy additional merchandise products for her trade. It would be more preferable if she has more direct-selling products to sell because it means additional income.

In the future, she dreams of havig a franchising business then eventually expand this. She also wishes to grow not just financially but also spiritually.

By faith, she hopes that you grant her request today.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: David King

texts.en:
David King is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, David King has been working hard to manage his recording studio, which deals in recording music.

To help expand his business, David King has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a new computer for the studio, and will help him to generate greater profits and meet client needs. He hopes that in the future he will be able to finish his house.

David King is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David King who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy a new computer for the studio

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, George has been working hard to manage his timber business, which deals in timber.

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help George to generate greater profits and increase sales. George hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase more stock.

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more timber

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Here is Estrella, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. Recently, she had a Kiva loan which she had used for her business within their vicinity. Actually, she sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why she would like to give her gratitude to those who lent her assistance previously.

To improve sales, Estrella would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional soft drinks to sell. With PHP 20,000, she can certainly make her livelihood improve and eventually grow with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you who will assist her in her project.

In the future, Estrella hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. In fact, she is saving money because she wants to invest in a car someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria de 52 años, vive en unión libre y no tiene hijos, desde hace 4 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes. 

Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. 

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Maria, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de ella y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old, lives with her partner and doesn't have any kids.  She's had a convenience store for 4 years.  Her dream is to expand her store where she distributes milk, grains, vegetables, and milk products among other articles.  She currently has very few products in stock so she cannot supply her clients with the products they request.  
Due to this situation, Maria decided to request a loan so she can get better organized and buy products wholesale like grains, sugar, crackers, and milk products so she can increase her offering and give better attention to her clients.  This will also represent an increase to her income so she can meet the basic needs of her business like the public services and taxes.  She will also improve the well being of her family.

loans.use: to expand her store where she distributes milk, grains, vegetables, and milk products among other articles.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de Medellín.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para darle una buena calidad de vida  a su hija por la cual aspira a darle un excelente futuro.
Trabaja sola durante 10 horas todos los días.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

Ella guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very nice woman who always has a smile for the clients that visit her convenience store in the municipality of Medellin.  Thanks to her charisma and good humor she's been able to win the hearts and the recognition of the people from the neighborhood who prefer to visit her store to buy her products.  She works everyday to give a good quality of life to her daughter for whom she aspires to give an excellent future.  She works alone for 10 hours everyday.  
She's currently requesting a loan so she can buy and stock her store with products like grains, groceries, candies, drinks, among other products and in that way give her store a boost.  She hopes to continue with her business and keep impacting positively the life of her clients through her good services.

loans.use: buy and stock her store with products like grains, groceries, candies, drinks, among other products.

loans.name: Gloria Estella

texts.es:
Ella es Gloria, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

Ella decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de comidas variadas desde hace aproximadamente 11 años en su casa con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por la cocina, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como carne, verduras, granos, entre otros.
Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.
Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman with strong character and good will, and with the hope to get ahead with her family.  She started preparing and selling various food plates from her house 11 years ago.  She learned the craft empirically with the need and her liking for the kitchen.  This allowed her to get great experience.  
She now wants to give her business a boost with the help of Kiva and Interactuar corporation.  She's requesting a loan to buy the ingredients for her food preparations like meat, vegetables, and grains, among other products.  With this loan she will support her business and make it grow everyday.  She's a woman who faces challenges with courage.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for her food preparations like meat, vegetables, and grains, among other products.

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en: Abdul is a young farmer standing in middle along with his group members in the picture. He is 22 years old and lives in a village called Ghayabi in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. Abdul and his group members are farmers that grow wheat and rice. They lack financial resources to purchase farming supplies. They are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and herbicides. This loan will enable them to increase their income and send their children to school. All the group members appreciate the help being extended to them and are committed to repay the borrowed money.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizers, pesticide,seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Riasat's Group

texts.en:
Riasat is a 38 year old farmer standing in the middle of the group in the picture. He lives in a village called Dera Bee Wali in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. He and his group members cultivate wheat and rice to earn their livelihood. They lack financial resources to timely finance agricultural inputs including seed, fertilizers, pesticides and fuel. They end up utilizing fewer and substandard inputs, resulting in low crop yields. 

This loan will allow them to purchase adequate agricultural inputs and increase their yield. This loan will also help them to sell their rice crop in the open market and gain more revenue, enabling them to support their families better. They are committed to be responsible group members.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizers, pesticide and seeds etc.

loans.name: Khuram's Group

texts.en:
Khuram is standing in the middle with his hand raised in the group picture. He is a poor farmer from Ghayabi, a village in District Gujranwala in Pakistan. He is 27 years old and strives to increase the yield of his crops by employing an optimum mix of agricultural inputs. 

One of the biggest challenges Khuram faces is the ability to finance the purchase of agricultural inputs. Since he has no other options, he has to rely on middle men who pledge the farmers' upcoming crop against the loan extended, and pay lesser prices compared to prevailing market rates. 

Khuram's group is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs which will release them from manipulation of these middle men, allow them to sell their crops at prevailing market rates, and increase their rate of return.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizers, pesticide and seeds  etc.

loans.name: Umar's Group

texts.en:
Umar is a young 22 year old farmer who lives in a village called Allah Ditta in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. He is the leader of his group of three borrowers. He is standing in the picture with his hand raised. He grows rice and wheat in his farm, but lacks financial resources to purchase supplies. His only option is to approach financial middlemen. These middlemen provide farming supplies at a high cost in exchange for future crops, but pay a lower rate for the crops than the open markets.

Umar and his group members are requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, quality seeds and fuel. This loan will enable them increase their revenue by avoiding the losses incurred from dealing with financial middlemen, and allow them to sell their crops at market rates. They are grateful for this loan, and are committed to make their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizers, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is standing in the middle with his hand raised. He is 50 years old and lives in a village called Allah Ditta, in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. He and his group members are progressive farmers who strive to increase their output by employing an optimum mix of agricultural inputs.

Due to lack of access to formal credit, Khursheed and his group members rely on middlemen to purchase seeds, fertilizers, fuel & pesticides. These middlemen exploit the cash-strapped farmers by advancing agricultural inputs at higher rates, and hedging their crops at a value lower than the open market prices. 

They are requesting a loan to purchase agriculture inputs on the open market at discounted rates. This loan will allow them to increase their crop output.

They look forward to being responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs i.e. fertilizers, pesticide and seeds etc.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad Lucero logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando en varios talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene un buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recubridora con la que podrá mejorar su producción, expandirse a nuevas empresas, y aumentar  su volumen de trabajo; dándole asi, la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así, contar la historia de que gracias a los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio
texts.en:
At her 47 years of age Lucero was able to consolidate her business of making clothes for third parties and her own clothing line thanks to the experience she had working in different workshops.  She works 9-11 hours a day from Monday to Saturday depending on the amount of work and she knows she has a good business thanks to her clients.  
She wants to expand her horizons and employ people in need so she's requesting a loan to buy a cover seam machine with which she will improve her production, expand into new enterprises and increase her work volume while at the same time giving someone else a job opportunity.  
Her dream is to keep growing and have her own workshop.  In this way she will be able to tell the story of how she was able to build a successful business thanks to the collaborators from Kiva and with the help of Interactuar corporation.

loans.use: to buy a cover seam machine with which she will improve her production and expand into new enterprises.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Con su negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, Alexandra ha podido sacar sus tres hijos adelante, brindándoles una buena educación y formándolos con excelentes valores.

Desarrolla su negocio en un pequeño coche que empuja por las distintas calles de la ciudad de Medellín. Le dedica a este negocio unas 10 horas aproximadamente.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar una moto que le permita desplazarse de una manera más sencilla por toda la ciudad y así poder cubrir una mayor cantidad de rutas.

Esto se verá reflejado en el aumento de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
With her business selling food products, Alexandra has been able to get ahead her 3 sons, giving them a good education and raising them with excellent values.  She conducts her business from a small cart which she pushes through the streets of Medellin.  She works around 10 hours everyday.  
She's requesting a loan to buy a motorbike that will allow her to move throughout the city more easily and thus be able to cover more routes.  This investment will be reflected in an increase to her income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike that will allow her to move throughout the city more easily.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre trabajador y humilde, cualidades que tiene muy bien merecidas ya que su labor de zapatero le han dado la oportunidad de conseguir el sustento para su familia.

Inicio este negocio hace 15 años a través de las enseñanzas de su padre quien le ofreció la oportunidad de aprender el oficio.

Hoy en día trabaja en un pequeño taller con unos ingresos bajos pero ganados con mucho esfuerzo.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, clavos, entre otros, elementos que le permitirán abastecer su negocio y poder generar una mejor producción de calzado.

Ayuda a Francisco a cumplir su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia a través de su trabajo
texts.en:
Francisco is a hard working and humble man, qualities that are very well deserved because thanks to his work as a shoemaker he's been able to provide support for his family.  He started his business 15 years ago by learning the craft from his father.  He currently works in a small workshop where he generates a low income albeit earned through a lot of effort.
He's requesting financial support to buy raw materials like leather, glue, and nails, among other products, which will allow him to stock his business and generate a better shoe production.  
Help Francisco achieve his dream of buying a house through the fruits of his labor.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like leather, glue, and nails, among other products, which will allow him to stock his business and generate a better shoe production.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que luchado incansablemente para salir adelante y progresar.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía ropa, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su familia.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de camisetas, jeans, camisas, ropa interior, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who has fought restlessly to achieve progress and get ahead.  She started selling clothes as a way to generate income while staying close to her family.  
She currently has very little capital and she's in the stage of acquiring clients. For this reason she's requesting a loan to buy wholesale t-shirts, jeans, shirts, and underwear, among other products, in this way stocking her small business with quality products.  
With the loan she'll be able to give her business a boost and will have a better variety of products to offer allowing her to consolidate her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale t-shirts, jeans, shirts, and underwear, among other products, in this way stocking her small business with quality products.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

El monto un café internet desde hace varios años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Tiene 69 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.
El solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos elementos de papelería como discos compactos al por mayor para surtir un poco sus vitrinas y exhibidores. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Este crédito tendrá un impacto positivo en su negocio pues podrá diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man with good ideas and a creative mind.  He's always looking for ways to increase his family's income.  He's 69 years old but he's ready full power to face the challenges that life may bring his way.  
He's requesting financial support to buy some stationery products like CDs at wholesale so he can stock his showcases and exhibition room.  With this money he will be able to invest in his business and attract more clients impacting his utilities in a positive way.  This loan will have a positive impact on his business by allowing him to diversify his products.

loans.use: to buy some stationery products like CDs at wholesale so he can stock his showcases and exhibition room.

loans.name: Andres Avelino

texts.es:
Andres, de 20 años, trabaja en el área de la construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de La Dorada, negocio que inicio el afán de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, la cual le permitirá desplazarse hasta los diferentes destinos de trabajo que tiene.

Esto hará que su trabajo sea mucho más sencillo, además de que podrá llevar su herramienta mucho más fácil y reduciendo costos.
texts.en:
Andres is 20 years old and works in construction and building remodeling in the municipality of La Dorarda.  He started his business with the goal of improving his quality of life.  
He's requesting a loan to buy a motorbike which will allow him to travel to the different destinations where he has to work.  This will make his work simpler and carrying the tools easier which will result in cost reduction.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike which will allow him to travel to the different destinations where he has to work.

loans.name: Yuli Andrea

texts.es:
Yuli una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica y sobre todo poder dedicar su tiempo a su hijo, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios a domicilios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. 
Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.

Espera crecer mucho más su negocio, en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado de un forma segura.

Su dificultad más grande es competencia que hay en la ciudad.
El crédito será utilizado para adquirir los muebles, equipos y productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.) con los que podrá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yuli has always been an entrepreneurial woman.  She's started various businesses with the goal of finding financial sustainability and mainly so she can dedicate time to her son.   
She's venturing into the world of beauty services by offering home services in hair styling, make up, nails, etc. and so far she's generated income to support her home.  She hopes to keep growing her business and in the future have her own beauty salon thus positioning herself more strongly in the market.  Her greatest difficulty is the competition in the city.  
The loan will be used to buy furniture, equipment, and beauty products (make-up, hair irons, sprays, styling cream, etc.) with which she'll be able to offer better quality services.

loans.use: to buy furniture, equipment, and beauty products (make-up, hair irons, sprays, styling cream, etc.)

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Benjamin, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 4 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja solo todos los días durante 9 horas.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Benjamin is a man with energy and perseverance to get ahead his family and his business.  He's been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 4 years working since the early morning everyday to offer his products.  He works alone every day for 9 hours.  
He started this project after seeing the necessity to generate more income for his family and because he didn't have enough studies to work in another job, so he opted for selling fruits and vegetables.  He's a very nice and helpful man always with the best of attitudes to attend his clients wishes and concerns.  
He's requesting financial aid to Interactuar Corporation to buy a large stock of vegetables and in this way be able to increase his offer and sell more products.  We enocurage you to lend and support him today!

loans.use: to buy a large stock of vegetables and in this way be able to increase his offer and sell more products.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo de cafe, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, 

Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre quiere tener su campo en optimas condiciones pero sabe que estos es muy costoso, por esta razón solicita un crédito para realizar la compra de insumos agropecuarios.
texts.en:
Luis is a humble farmer who every morning goes to work in his coffee field.  He's fully dedicated to his work and he only thinks about getting ahead and delivering a good product since he knows that a lot of people consume it.  Because of this every drop of sweat that drips from his forehead is from the effort that he puts in everyday so that his products are pure and of good quality.  
Like all good farmers, he wants to have his field in the best of conditions but he knows that this is very expensive.  For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural materials for his fields.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials for his fields.

loans.name: Arnulfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Arnulfo con 47 años de edad es casado. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de papa y complementa con la producción de leche, de algunas vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de papa, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de El Peñol, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Arnulfo es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Arnulfo is 47 years old and married.  He was raised in a rural area where he has been involved in agricultural activities most of his life.  He has some potato crops and complements these with milk production from some cows that he owns.  He sells daily the potatoes and the milk at the El Peñol market and this allows him to have the necessary resources for the daily sustenance of his home.  
Arnulfo is a serious and responsible man, committed to his family and his work which is why he always wants to keep getting ahead in search of a better future.  For this reason he's requesting a loan to invest in buying agricultural materials like fertilizers and pesticides with the goal of continuing to take care of his crops and have a harvest with the best conditions.  All of this will help him get ahead, slowly improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying agricultural materials like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose Cecilio

texts.es: José de 27 años de edad, es soltero y habita  en casa propia junto a una hermana de 25 años y su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad. José  posee un negocio de venta de accesorios usados para vehículos ubicado a orilla de una carretera en el mercado más cercano a su  de residencia adicional a eso también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de maíz, por lo que gracias a su ardua labor logra solventar los  gastos de su hogar. José en vista de mejorar su vivienda y brindar mayor protección a su familia  está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de ladrillo, piedra y cemento para la construcción de un muro de contención ya que actualmente cuenta con uno de lámina y le genera inseguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
