Jose is 27 years old, single, and lives in his own home with a 25 year old sister and her 6 year old daughter.  Jose manages a business selling used car accessories by the side of the road near the closest market to his home.  Additionally, he also works in agriculture cultivating corn.  Thanks to his hard work he's able to cover the home expenses.  
Jose wants to improve his home and provide better protection for his family so he's requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy bricks, stones, and cement for building a fence because right now the fence is only made of zinc sheets and that is not very safe for his family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, stones, and cement for building a fence.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 48-year-old lady living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to do so. 

Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy a moto rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is 32 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past five years, Ivan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread and posho. 

To help expand his business, Ivan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread and posho. It will help Ivan to generate greater profits and pay school fees. 

Ivan hopes that in the future he will be able to become a well known agro-processor. 

Ivan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ivan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more  sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread and posho.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es: Carmen es una señora de 41 años de edad, Carmen  es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos de las edades de 3, 15, 17, 18 y 23 años de edad, Carmen tiene su negocio en un cuarto por el que paga arriendo, pero comenta que la va bien porque esta ubicado frente a un colegio y que sus principales clientes son los estudiantes, Carmen solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de papas y demás implementos para vender su producto que se llama papitas caseras, la aspiración de Carmen es la de seguir en su trabajo para que sus ingresos le permitan pagar las necesidades de sus hijos y sobre todo los estudios de sus  3 hijos que asisten al colegio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 41 year old single mother with 5 children of age 3, 15, 17, 18, and 23 years.  Carmen rents a small room where she has her business and it is going very well for her because it is located in front of a school and her main clients are the students.  
Carmen is requesting a loan to invest in buying potatoes and other materials to make and sell her product which are home baked potatoes.  Carmen's goal is to keep working so that her income allows her to pay for her children's needs and especially for the education of 3 of her children who are currently attending school.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Rahmawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rahmawati, one of Ruma’s agents. Rahmawati lives in Semarang, the capital of Central Java, nine hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Rahmawati is happily married, and together with her husband, she has one daughter and one son. She owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. 

As the business grows, Rahmawati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. This is important to her, and your loan will be very useful to help Rahmawati improve her business and her community, which needs access to such service. 

In the near future, Rahmawati's goal in regard to Ruma is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, which is part of Ruma's latest product called Mapan. Rahmawati thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her local community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es:
Ramos es un hombre que actualmente tiene 32 años de edad, vive muy feliz mente con su amada familia en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá. Ramos se encuentra muy satisfecho por el apoyo que recibió en el momento de salir beneficiado con el crédito, afortunadamente con este apoyo el logro comprar sus insumos agrícolas  y obtuvo muy buena cosecha, con esta buena producción el género una buena ganancia y la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado bastante. Pero Ramos nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un crédito para poder comprar sus insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de cebollines pues este tipo de cebolla en su comunidad no es tan común por lo que para él es bastante rentable.
El gran sueño de ramos es aumentar sus ganancias con esta cosecha y comprar un terreno para seguir aumentando su cultivo.
texts.en:
Ramos is a 32 year old man who lives happily with his loving family in a community from the Department of Sololá.  Ramos is very satisfied with the support received with the previous credit which enabled him to buy agricultural materials and he obtained a very good harvest.  With this good production he was able to generate a good profit and the quality of life of his family has improved significantly.  
Ramos again has the need of requesting a loan to buy agricultural materials for cultivating chives since this type of onion is not very common in his community which makes it very profitable.  Ramos' big dream is to increase his profits with this harvest and to buy an agricultural field so he can keep increasing his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials for cultivating chives.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Lolita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married and has a buy and sell fruits and vegetable business in the Philippines. Yolanda has been in this business for years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetable to sell.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Odete

texts.en:
Odete lives in Dili, and she is a businesswoman. 

She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for her business and her shop is in the center of the market, so many people come to buy every day. 

Odete has been involved in business activities since 2007. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling shoes, so she is still happy to do her business. She is selling shoes and she also sells bags and other things. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more items in her kiosk including shoes, socks and bags.

loans.use: To buy shoes, socks, bags and other items.

loans.name: N2 Pxuân Hưng Lộc - Repay On Time Group

texts.en:
Thương is 37 years old and she is married. Thương lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover, the market need is low in this region. 
 
She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thương faces is lack of capital.
  
In 2011, Thương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thương has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is group leader of the "N2 PXuân Hưng Lộc - Repay on time" group now. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

Thương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ryan, one of Ruma’s agents. Ryan lives in Semarang, the capital of Central Java, nine hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Ryan is happily married and, together with her husband, she has one son. 

She owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, some stationery and mobile airtime credits. As the business grows, Ryan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. This is important to her because your loan will be very useful to help Ryan improve her business and her community, which needs access to such services. 

Ryan's goal in regard to Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, which is part of Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so later, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Ryan thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her local community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 47 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Consolacion has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Consolacion requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Consolacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rumaldo

texts.es: Rumaldo se dedica a la agricultura, cría de cerdos y ganado desde hace cuatro años, en una pequeña comunidad del departamento de Atlántida. El y su esposa Antonia saben lo importante que es darles la mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es por eso que anteriormente compro un sistema solar, que le ayudaba con la iluminación y la carga de teléfonos celulares, pero hace un tiempo atrás se dañaron las baterías, las cuales son necesarias para que el sistema  funcione,  por este motivo  de nuevo tuvieron que utilizar  velas y lámparas de kerosén para iluminarse por las noches. Es por esta razón que Rumaldo necesita un  préstamo de Soluz Honduras para adquirir las baterías y reactivar el  sistema solar  para que su hija pequeña pueda seguir estudiando con una mejor iluminación y su esposa realice de forma más eficiente las labores del hogar.
texts.en: Rumaldo has worked in agriculture, raising pigs and cattle, for the past four years, in a small community in the Atlántida department.  He and his wife Antonia know how important it is to give the best quality of life to their children, and it's for that reason that they previously purchased a solar energy system, that helped with illumination and charging cell phones, but awhile ago, the batteries were damaged, and they are necessary for the system to function, so now, they again have to use kerosene lanterns to have light at night.  For this reason, Rumaldo needs a loan from Soluz Honduras to acquire batteries and reactivate the solar energy system so that his small daughter can continue studying with better lighting and his wife can more efficiently complete household tasks.

loans.use: to purchase a sustainable package for the reactivation of his solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Yeudy Miguel

texts.es:
Yeudy Miguel es un joven estudiante de Ingenieria Industrial, él solicita un préstamo para cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Yeudy,  tengo 17 años. Nací en (Caribe, Bonao Rep. Dom) una comunidad rural tabacalera y cacaotera, vivo con mis padres, mi madre es enfermera y mi padre jardinero,  tengo dos hermanas mayor y menor que yo, mi hermana mayor estudió con un crédito educativo de FUNDAPEC vía FALCONDO lo que me motivo a solicitar un crédito para estudiar mi carrera preferida ingeniería industrial, mi hermana menor esta en 4to grado del nivel secundario y nuestra meta es ser tres excelentes profesionales. 

Acabo de iniciar mis estudios,  en Ing. Industrial  en la Universidad UCATECI de La Vega cursando mi primer cuatrimestre, estoy muy emocionado pues tengo un futuro prometedor, pues es una carrera de muchos logros y de resultados maravillosos.
  
Mi familia no cuenta con suficientes recursos para sustentar mis estudios y los de mi hermana que pronto será universitaria, razón por la cual me acerco a KIVA para que me ayuden en lo económico y yo estudiar y luego ser quien pague mis estudios. 

Además quiero ser un buen ejemplo para los jóvenes de mi comunidad y demostrarles que si podemos lograr lo que nos propongamos, no importa la distancia ni la precariedad económica, también mi mayor deseo es darle a mis padres los cuidados que merecen por el gran esfuerzo que han hecho por nosotros.

Creo que  KIVA  y FUNDAPEC es el medio más idóneo para ayudarnos a alcanzar nuestras metas.
texts.en:
Yeudy Miguel is a young student of Industrial Engineering. He is asking for a loan to cover his education costs. This is his story:

"My name is Yeudy and I am 17 years old. I was born in a rural tobacco- and cocoa-producing community (Caribe, Bonao in Dominican Republic). I live with my parents. My mother is a nurse and my father is a gardener. I have two sisters, older and younger than me. My older sister studied with an education loan from FUNDAPEC through Falcondo which is what motivates me to ask for a loan to study my chosen degree in Industrial Engineering. My younger sister is in the 4th grade of secondary school and our goal is to be three excellent professionals. 

I have just started my studies in Industrial Engineering at the UCATECI University in La Vega. I am studying my first term and I am very excited as I have a promising future because this is a degree with many achievements and marvelous results. 

My family does not have enough resources to support my studies and those of my sister who will soon be a university student. This is the reason why I approached Kiva to help me financially so I can study and then be able to pay for my studies. I also want to be a good example for the young people in my community and show them that we can achieve whatever we set out to, no matter the distance or financial insecurity. Also my greatest desire is to give my parents the care they deserve for the great effort that they have made for us. 

I think that Kiva and FUNDAPEC is the most appropriate means to help us to reach our goals."

loans.use: to cover higher education costs.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina, a sus 19 años de edad, es soltera, Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado como vendedora en una tienda de abarrotes, la misma que hoy en día es de su propiedad, pues el antiguo jefe le brindó la oportunidad de comprarla y pasar de ser empleada a propietaria de su unidad productiva. 

Allí trabaja sola todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor Como carne, granos, abarrotes y legumbres, así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda. 

Lina, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio, se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando la calidad de vida y tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Lina is a 19 year old single woman.  During her productive life she has worked as a saleswoman in a convenience store which she now owns since the previous owner gave her the opportunity to buy the store allowing her to transition from employee to owner.  She works by herself everyday generating enough income to cover her home's basic needs. Her tenacity, vision, perseverance, and optimism have allowed her to overcome the diverse obstacles along the way, especially with the large number of competitors in the area.  However, she has been able to manage the situation and has taken advantage of the store's reputation which has been in business for a long time.
She's currently requesting a loan to buy wholesale stocks of meat, grains, groceries, and vegetables.  In this way she'll have enough stock to satisfy the demand.  Lina dreams of expanding her business and visualizes the moment when her business is well established in the market so that she can have it grow and last over time, thus improving her quality of life and her well being.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stocks of meat, grains, groceries, and vegetables.  In this way she'll have enough stock to satisfy the demand.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 34 years old and lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art, and he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. 

He uses tools such as brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, chisel and level, which have all been wearing out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these tools.
 
Therefore, Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.
Nussrat thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's mason services so that he can construct buildings.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes tiendas de abarrotes en el municipio de Apartado.
Es una madre amorosa y responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia (Ver Foto a su Esposo) en su proceso productivo.

Ella siempre ha sido muy inquieta y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que la motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en el sector.

Hoy en día es una mujer amable y muy emprendedora, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.

Ella solicita apoyo económico para obtener un préstamo y realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran distribuidora de víveres, considera que poco a poco y con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Flor has had very gratifying experiences in her life including having worked at different convenience stores in the municipality of Apartado.  She's a loving a responsible mother and her family is very important in her productive process (see picture with her husband).  
She's always been restless and with a great vocation for service, qualities that helped her start her own convenience store and make it very well known in the area.  She's a very nice and entrepreneurial woman who always looks for alternatives to make her clients feel they are taken care of and they keep buying her quality products.
She's requesting financial support to get a loan to buy stock of family and home products to increase her offering and to have a larger inventory allowing her to always have the products available for her clients.  
Her biggest dream is to become a large product distributor which she believes she can achieve slowly with the help of Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to buy stock of family and home products.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 38 ans, Ayaba est une femme qui vit à Nyékonakpoè avec ses deux enfants. Commerçante, Ayaba vend des brochettes de poulets rôtis dans son quartier afin d’avoir son revenu. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Ayaba s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Ayaba demande ce crédit pour commander poulets, des bidons d’huile et des tas d’épices afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Ayaba is a 38 year old married woman who lives in Nyékonakpoè with her two children.  As a business-woman, Ayaba sells roasted chicken kebabs in her neighborhood in order to earn an income.  To effectively respond to the demands, she resupplies once a month at the market.  Ayaba requests this loan so that she can order chickens, containers of oil and spices in order to earn even more to help her husband with the family’s daily costs.

loans.use: acheter 72 poulets, 3 bidons d'huile et 6 tas d'épices

loans.name: Rosa Araceli

texts.es: Rosa es una joven trabajadora, ella vive con su madre y 2 hermanos, Rosa tiene 26 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la crianza de pollos que los compra pequeñitos y los va criando con mucho cuidado y al momento que ya crecen los vende obteniendo alguna ganancia, Rosa también se dedica a cuidar 4 niños por lo que le pagan y ya obtiene otro ingreso, Rosa solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la comprar de pollos, Rosa tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y de seguir trabajando para prepararse para el futuro ya que tiene en mente formar una familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26 years old, is a hardworking young woman. She lives with her mother and two brothers. 

She works raising chickens. She buys the chicks, carefully tends them and sells them when grown up to get some income. 

Rosa also works  babysitting four children for which she gets paid, thus adding to her income. 

She is requesting this loan to buy chicks. Rosa intends to improve her business and continue working so that she can prepare herself for the future, because she is looking to form a family.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou vit à Djidjolé et est âgée de 33 ans. Mariée, Akou est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Akou vend du yaourt préparé au couscous à base lait à ses clients dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Akou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de lait et du couscous, Akou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité afin de permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Akou lives in Djidjolé and is 33 years old.  Akou is married and the mother of 4 children and works dynamically to support their education.  Akou sells yogurt prepared with milk-based couscous to her clients in the neighborhood to earn an income necessary for the subsistence of her family.  Akou gets her supplies two times per month at the market.  Akou requests this loan so that she can order cartons of milk and couscous and extend her profitability to allow her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Bladimir Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro vive con su madre y un tío, el es un joven trabajador, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y también trabaja de panadero, Alejandro se dedica 3 años a la crianza y comercialización de pollos, por este motivo desea el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para tenerlos en un galpón apropiado y darles buen cuidado para que su negocio siga surgiendo, Alejandro comenta que su negocio es familiar ya que es a medias con su madre y con una prima, Alejandro manifiesta que el proceso de su negocio es comprar pollos pequeñitos y criarlos adecuadamente y cuando ya están grandes los entrega ya pelados y listos para prepararlos, Alejandro tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando y que su negocio crezca, para mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su madre.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives with his mother and uncle. He is a young hard-worker, making a living raising chickens and also works as a baker. Alejandro has devoted three years to breeding and marketing chickens. For this reason he wants a loan to invest it in the purchase of chickens to keep them in a suitable shed and give them good care so that his business continues to grow. Alejandro says that his business is familiar to him because of his mother and cousin. Alejandro says that the process of his business is purchasing young chicks and raising them properly and when they are grown and ready, they are prepared for delivery.

Alejandro has the aspiration to continue working and growing his business to improve the quality of life for him and his mother.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Cantinflas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cantinflas está integrado por once mujeres trabajadoras y especialmente comprometidas con sus familias. Ellas son originarias de una comunidad veracruzana cuyos fundadores la nombraron “La novia del sol” en referencia al clima tan cálido. Actualmente es una zona industrializada y con una amplia actividad agrícola y ganadera. 
   La inspiración para el nombre del grupo de préstamo surgió del sobrenombre del artista mexicano Mario Moreno ya que para los miembros, es un ejemplo de éxito y humildad. Los integrantes son: María G. quien vende artículos para limpieza; Margarita, frutas; Agustina, Ernestina, comida; Yomira, artículos de plata; Rosa María M., tamales y dulces típicos; Delia, cosméticos; Francisca, zapatos y comida; Rosa, abarrotes mientras que María Eugenia A. y María Eugenia Q. tienen un centro nutricional. 
   En un inicio, Doña María Eugenia Q. sólo vendía bolsas para dama, esta actividad la comenzó desde hace cinco años con el propósito de apoyar en los gastos de su  hogar. Posteriormente pudo seguir adelante con sus metas, “gracias a las ganancias y las oportunidades de préstamo pude iniciar una nueva actividad” comenta. Abrió un club nutricional en donde ofrece diversos alimentos y complementos para mantener una dieta saludable.
   El negocio tiene competencia pero Doña María se muestra confiada pues ha demostrado ofrecer el mejor producto y la mejor atención de la zona. Con la ayuda de este nuevo préstamo podrá invertir en la compra de bolsas de mano y polvos de diferentes sabores para la fabricación de malteadas.
   Una meta que quiere realizar lo más pronto posible es abrir un nuevo centro nutricional para aumentar sus ventas. Lo único que desea es que sus tres hijos continúen con sus estudios profesionales. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de  Doña Rosa, Doña Eugenia es quien viste blusa negra y está en cuclillas delante de sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cantinflas" is made up of 11 hardworking women who are particularly devoted to their families.  They are natives of a community in Veracruz whose founders named it "The Bride of the Sun" because of its very hot climate.  Now it is an industrial area that also has a lot of agriculture and livestock production.

The inspiration for the name of this group comes from the nickname of the Mexican artist Mario Moreno, because for these members, he is an example of success and humility.  The members of this group are: Maria G., who sells cleaning products; Margarita, who sells fruit, Agustina and Ernestina, who sell food; Yomira, who sells items made of silver; Rosa Maria M., who sells tamales and traditional sweets; Delia, who sells cosmetics; Francisca, who sells shoes and food; Rosa, who sells groceries; and Maria Eugenia A.and Maria Eugenia Q. who have a nutritional center.

At the start, Maria Eugenia Q. sold only ladies handbags. She started this business 5 years ago with the goal of supporting the household expenses.  Later she was able to  move forward with her goals. "Thanks to the earnings and opportunities from my loans, I was able to start up a  new business," she comments.  She opened a nutritional club where she offers a variety of foods and supplements to maintain a healthy diet.  In this business there is competition, but Maria is confident because she has demonstrated that she has the best products for sale and provides the best service in the area.  With the help of this new loan, she will be able to invest in handbags and a variety of flavors of powders to make shakes.      

One goal that she wants to achieve as soon as possible is to open a new nutritional center  to increase her sales.  The only thing she wants is for her 3 children to continue with their professional studies.                

Note: This photograph was taken in Rosa's house.  Eugenia is seen wearing a black shirt and is on her knees in front of her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy handbags and nutritional shakes

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
Senhora Laura tem 35 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com o seu esposo, não tem filhos, trabalha como empregada domestica, vive em casa própria, sustenta uma sobrinha.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, pedra, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa aumentando mais um quarto visto que a casa é do tipo 1.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e encontrar alternativas de ter um meio de transporte pessoal visto que é difícil depender de transporte publico.
O seu desafio e de terminar o empréstimo sem entrar em atrasos como forma de garantir futuros financiamentos e dai realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Laura is 35 years old, lives with her husband and does not have children. She works as a maid, lives in her own home and supports a niece financially. 

The loan will be used to buy cement, sand and stones to continue building her house and add another room as she lives in a one bedroom house.

In the future she hopes to finish building her home and find an alternative form of personal transport since depending on public transport is difficult.

Her challenge is to finish her loan without falling behind so she can guarantee future loans and carry out her projects.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stones to continue buliding her house

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
A senhora  Fátima tem 49 anos de idade é operária agrícola e mãe solteira de 07 filhos , dos quais 04 já nas casas próprias, 3 sob sua responsabilidade, 01 a estudar, vive na casa propria, sustenta 02 netos que vivem com ela .
Diz que com este credito irá comprar cimento, varões, chapas, barotes, para ampliar a sua casa com mais um quarto para seus filhos. 
Seu sonho é terminar a sua obra, mobilar e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família .
Seu desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para ultrapassa-lo faz xitique e tem machambas onde produz para o sustento familiar, diz que irá solicitar mais crédito para a realizacao dos seus planos.
texts.en:
Fátima is 49 years old, a farmer and a single mother of seven children of whom four live in their own homes and three are under her care with one studying. She lives in her own home and financially supports two grandchildren who live with her.  

Fátima says that with this loan she will buy cement, poles, sheeting and beams to extend her house by adding another room for her children. 

Fátima's dream is to finish building, furnish the room and improve her family's living conditions. Her challenge is having insufficient funds but to overcome that she takes part in xitique, an informal credit and savings group, as well as tending to her plots of land whose produce sustains her family. She says that she will apply for more loans to put her plans into action.

loans.use: to buy cement, poles, sheeting and beams

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kiboga in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, and posho. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, and posho, and will help John to generate greater profits and increase his income. John hopes that in the future he will be able to operate his own shop. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more  sugar, salt, soap, sodas, rice, beans, bread, and posho

loans.name: Massavi

texts.fr: Massavi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans. Mère de quatre enfants, Massavi vit à Djidjolé pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Massavi vend des pagnes dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Massavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Massavi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité afin de soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en: Massavi is a 33 year old married woman.  She is the mother of four children and lives in Djidjolé where she undertakes her activities.  To respond to the needs of her family, Massavi walks around selling traditional pagne fabric in her neighborhood.  Massavi gets her supplies twice a month at the market.  In order to have a new stock, Massavi requests this loan to buy pieces of pagne fabric which she can sell and make a good profit to help her husband to fulfill the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy 6 pieces of pagne (traditional fabric used for skirts)

loans.name: Zhumahan

texts.ru: Жумахан, 47 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жумахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 6 овец. На 2,0 Га она выращивает рис и клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумахан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и обработку почвы для выращивания экологически-чистого риса. Доходы от кредита Жумахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее хозяйства.
texts.en: Zhumahan is 47 years old, married, and has a son. She has a secondary education. She goes through life with optimism and knows exactly what she wants and achieves everything through her own efforts. She rears animals and grows crops for income for her family, having started 20 years ago. Thanks to Zhumahan's hard work, today she has four cows and six sheep. She grows rice and clover for sale on 2.0 hectares of land. In order to develop her business further, Zhumahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep and to cultivate her land to grow organic rice. Zhumahan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land for growing organic rice and to buy some sheep.

loans.name: Gulzhamila

texts.ru: Гулжамила, 42 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. Образование средне-специальное. Много лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец. Гулжамила знает всю технологию, регулярно делает прививки. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку рассады и удобрений для выращивания экологически чистых арбузов. Гулжамила является лидером группы "Мирзакул", всего в группе состоят 4 человека. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Gulzhamila is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary specialist education. She began working in agriculture many years ago: rearing animals and growing crops. She has four cows and ten sheep. Gulzhamila knows all the technology and regularly carries out inoculations. Her monthly profit is about 9,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seedlings and fertilizer to grow organic watermelon. Gulzhamila is the leader of the "Mirzakul" group which comprises four people in total. She will invest the proceeds of the business in buying a car.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer to grow organic watermelon.

loans.name: Las Bellas Group

texts.es:
Conformado por once mujeres sumamente trabajadoras, el grupo Las Bellas mantiene siempre un gran entusiasmo en favor de sus familias. El grupo es originario de una pequeña localidad veracruzana conocida por su amplia producción de caña de azúcar y su intensa actividad ganadera.
   Las integrantes de  Las Bellas son: Dominga quien vende comida; Adriana, cosméticos y comida; Romarica, piñatas y comida; Aurora, Isela y María, zapatos y Marina, ropa. Por su parte Antonia maneja una panadería; Yolanda, una herrería; Rafaela, una repostería y Zurisadai, una estética. 
   Doña Adriana es una mujer comprometida con su familia que está integrada por Jaime, su esposo, y tres hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Adri, como es mejor conocida, lleva diez años dedicados a la venta de tamales, chiles rellenos y pan con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
   Los chiles rellenos son un platillo típico en el país cuya realización merece una gran técnica y un mejor sazón. Adri lo sabe y por ello, para prepararlos, desvena los chiles y los pone a hervir en una vaporera a la cual le agrega café y azúcar para disminuir el  exceso de picante y darle un toque personal. Mientras tanto pica cebolla, jitomate, pasas y  plátano que se cocinarán junto con la carne molida; una vez que la mezcla se encuentra en la estufa, ella se encarga de batir el huevo que servirá para cubrir los chiles una vez preparados. El siguiente paso es rellenar con la carne cada chile, cubrirlos con harina, untarlos en el huevo y finalmente freírlos en aceite muy caliente. Para acompañar el platillo guisa arroz rojo con verdura.
   Doña Adri dedica sus mañanas a preparar la comida mientras que por las tardes recorre las calles de distintas colonias para ofrecer el rico pan que elabora su suegra.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas ha remodelado su casa que pasó de tener paredes de madera y techo de lámina a tener un cimiento firme de loza; “trabajando arduamente, en equipo hemos logrado construir una nueva casa” comenta contenta. Esta vez con el préstamo podrá comprar queso y 15 pollos en pluma para iniciar una nueva actividad.

*En la fotografía, Adri muestra los chiles rellenos que prepara.
texts.en:
Made up of very hardworking women, the Las Bellas group always have a lot of enthusiasm for their families. The group is from a small locality in  Veracruz known for its ample production of sugar cane and its intensive livestock activity.

The members of Las Bellas are: Dominga, who sells food; Adriana, cosmetics and food; Romarica, piñatas and food; Aurora, Isela and María, shoes, and Marina, clothes. Antonia runs a bread bakery; Yolanda, a hardware store; Rafaela, a pastry business and Zurisadai, a beauty salon. 

Adriana is a women who is dedicated to her family, which is made up of Jaime, her husband, and three children who are in school in the community. Adri, as a well known woman, has been selling tamales, chiles rellenos and bread for 10 years with the purpose of improving her family's quality of life.  

Chiles rellenos are a traditional food in the country and making them needs good technique and better seasoning.  Adri knows how to do it. She deveins chiles and boils them in a steamer to which she adds coffee and sugar to decrease the excess spiciness and give them a personal touch. Meanwhile, she dices onions, tomatoes, raisins and plantain, which will be cooked with the ground meat. Once the mixture is on the stove, she beats the eggs that will be used to cover the chiles once they are prepared. The next step is filling the chiles with the ground meat, covering them with flour, spread the egg mixture on them and finally fry them in very hot oil. To accompany the dish she cooks red rice with vegetables. 

Adri spends her mornings preparing the food and in the afternoons she goes to the streets of different neighborhoods to offer the delicious bread her mother in law makes. 

With the profits she has earned she has remodeled her house  went from having wood walls and a metal sheeting roof to having a firm tile floor. "Working hard as a team, we have been able to build a new house," she remarks happily. This time, she will buy cheese and 15 feathered chickens with the loan to start a new activity. 

*In th ephotogrpah, Adri is showing the chiles rellenos she makes.

loans.use: to buy cheese and 15 feathered chickens.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer que ha aprendido a trabajar desde muy joven, empezó a ser comerciante vendiendo frituras, luego se casó y procreo dos hijos, que ahora son adolescentes, el hecho de expandir su familia y la dura situación, la llevo a buscar una forma de generar un ingreso para su hogar, tanta ha sido perseverancia, que paso de tener una pequeña tienda a tener la estable pulpería que tiene en la actualidad.
Esta mujer, piensa siempre en una forma de hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que ha solicitado la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un financiamiento que le permita comprar nueva mercaderia como granos basicos y productos de aseo personal, con los que no cuenta. En un futuro desea invertir en un negocio de salón de belleza, además de sacar adelante a sus hijos, volverlos unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Maribel is a woman who has learnt to work from a very young age. She started out in business selling fried food, then she got married and had two children, who are now adolescents. The fact of having a growing family and the tough situation led her to look for another way of generating an income for her household. She has had so much perseverance that she has moved on from having a small shop to having the stable grocery shop which she currently has. 

Maribel is always thinking about how to make her business grow and this is why she has asked for Kiva's help through MiCrédito, so she can be provided with a loan which allows her to buy new merchandise such as basic grains and personal hygiene products, which she does not have.

In the future she would like to invest in a beauty salon, as well as bringing up her children and turning them into successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise such as basic grains and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his farming business, which deals in agriculture. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agriculture products, and will help Jackson to generate greater profits and improve his business. Jackson hopes that in the future, he will be able to earn profits. 

Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more agriculture products

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 55 years old. She is married with six children. She lives with her family in Dumanjug, Cebu. She sells fish and squid to earn an income. Estrella would like to earn better because she wants her children to continue going to school. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fish, crab and squid, and pay for tuition fees. Estrella is motivated to work hard for her family. Her income will be utilized for healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy fish, crab and squid, and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Lorraine

texts.en:
Lorraine is from Alcantara, Cebu. She is 32 years old and married with two children aged ten and eleven. 

For the last five years, Lorraine has been engaged in dealing and installing of Cignal Digital TV, which is a subscription-based Direct-To-Home (DTH) satellite television service provider in the Philippines. She earns commissions from this dealership. 

Lorraine is asking a loan to pay for transport, tuition fee for her children and food for family consumption.

In the future, she plans to have a bigger business using her own capital.

loans.use: to pay for transport, tuition fee and food for family consumption

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie works hard to support her family. Gerlie is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Gerlie has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Gerlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato works hard to support his family. Renato is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Renato requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to his customers.

He has been in this business for 12 years now.

Renato would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to his customers

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Necita works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling salted eggs and dried fish. 

Necita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for vegetables business.

Necita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has piped water but no electricity. 

Elizabeth  has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 46 años, tiene dos hijos y estudio una licenciatura en cosmiatría, es un mujer apasionada por la belleza, la estética y la imagen personal, razón por la cual desde hace un año inicio una estética - spa en la cual se dedica al: embellecimiento físico,  cortes, tintes, tratamientos faciales, corporales,  en fin todo lo que tenga que ver con el mundo de la belleza, un reto que tiene en mente es ampliarse a una nueva sucursal el próximo año, por ahora ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 15,000 para poder comprar materia prima para sus tratamientos así como invertir en publicidad, ya que su principal dificultad es la competencia desleal. Es una mujer que siempre busca opciones para llegar a sus objetivos y que nunca se da por vencida, ella agradece mucho a las personas que se convertirán en sus aliados para llegar a su meta.
texts.en: Silvia, 46, has 2 children and studied for a degree in skin care.  She is a woman who is passionate about beauty, aesthetics, and the personal image.  This is why she started a beauty spa business a year ago.  In her spa, she provides services for physical beautification, including: haircuts, hair coloring,  facial and body treatments, and in short, everything to do with the world of beauty.  One challenge she has in mind is to open a new branch next year.  This is why she is now requesting a loan of 15,000 Mexican pesos to buy raw materials for her treatments and to invest in publicity, because her main difficulty is the unfair competition.  She is a woman who always seeks options to achieve her goals, and she never gives up.  Silvia is very grateful to the people who are becoming her allies in her efforts to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to invest in advertising

loans.name: Inam

texts.en:
Inam is a 39-years-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. During the last violence on Gaza, the family house has been partially destroyed.
 
Inam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to repair part of the family house by buying construction supplies. 
Inam appears in the photo

loans.use: to repair part of the family house, damaged by war, by buying construction supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. One of them is currently in school. For the past 11 years, James has been working hard to manage his hardware business, which sells electronic items. 

To help expand his business James has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronic items and will help  James to generate greater profits. James hopes that in the future he will be able to develop a piece of land. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like  James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more electronic items to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Julius has been working hard to manage his restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items, and will help Julius to generate and earn greater profits. Julius hopes that in the future, he will be able to improve his income. 

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Julius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking woman. She is 57 years old and has been a vegetable vendor for 12 years. She sell carrots, christophene, ginger, bottle gourd, squash, spring onions, cabbages and peppers. 

She is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, eggplant and carrots, and pay for the tuition fee of her 17-year-old child. Marilou works hard for her children and only hopes that they will have a good life in the future.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, eggplant and carrots, and pay for the tuition fee of her 17-year-old child

loans.name: Bnd Lamadi Grp Group

texts.en:
Gaudensia , who is in her early 40s, is married with four girls who are still in school. She has been a fish seller for 10 years now. She works from 7am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Gaudensia's second loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase working capital in her fish business. She dreams of expanding her fish business. She will share this loan with her loan group, Lamadi, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase working capital in her fish business

loans.name: Adulfa

texts.en:
Adulfa is very hardworking mother from the town of Loon, Bohol. She has four grown adult children. 

Adulfa engages in selling fresh fish to the local people in her place. Her husband is a fisherman and a carpenter also.

She has been in the fish vending business for more than 20 years. She needs additional capital to support her existing livelihood.

Adulfa is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as a battery for a flashlight, a fishing net, and tools for carpentry. With these, it could cause her to improve her catch and enable her to sell more fresh fish. This will augment her earnings and help her to settle her obligations. With these, she could start to expand her fishing business. 

Adulfa is energetic enough to continue to handle her fish vending business to be successful in the years to come and improve her family's living conditions as well.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as a battery for a flashlight, a fishing net, and tools for carpentry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as bananas, wheat flour, sugar, margarine and more vegetables

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Maximina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Maximina has been in this business for eight years. Maximina earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Maximina dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 32 years old, married and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leah has a food market business in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Leah has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Leah would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es:
El señor Rafael desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando algunos lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
Since he was very young, Rafael has done farm work such as agriculture and raising animals. His father taught him these activities so that he could get ahead in life.  

Today his main activity is agriculture and livestock. His goal is to improve his capital by buying some lots of livestock which will allow him to increase his stock and generate better income. That is the reason he is asking for a loan. 

He is a responsible and loving father to his children. He lives in a farm with them and his wife, who has been his greatest companion.

He dreams of being able to give his children a quality education so that in the future they can fend for themselves and be independent. 

He attends to his business every day and tries to do things very well. He knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to improve his capital by buying lots of livestock which will allow him to increase his stock and generate better income.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 62 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Thelma has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and renovate her store.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 56 years old and married with 10 children. 

Olivia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Olivia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Olivia has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Olivia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mkuu

texts.en:
Mkuu is a married woman and has four school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer to grow organic watermelon.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 46 años, es casada, ella estudio una licenciatura en administración de empresas, es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta trabajar por su propia cuenta y no depender económicamente de ninguna institución, ella inicio hace 13 años un negocio de venta de ropa por catálogo, actualmente ella es distribuidora diamante lo cual habla de una persona de retos, su dificultad más grande es tener liquidez para poder invertir en nueva mercancía, por eso ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 5,000 para obtener mercancía, de esta forma la situación de invertir estaría resuelta y solo se enfocaría en ofrecer la ropa y cobrar. Su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir creciendo en su negocio y subir a la última categoría: nivel esmeralda, ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que la ayuden a cumplir su sueño y estar en el lugar que quiere estar.
texts.en:
Raquel is 46 years old and is married. She studied for a degree in business administration. She is an enterprising woman who likes to work on her own initiative and not depend financially on any institutions. Thirteen years ago she started a business selling clothing from catalogues. She is currently a 'diamond' distributor which shows she is a person who takes on challenges. 

Her biggest obstacle is having liquidity to invest in new merchandise, and this is why she is asking for a loan of MXN5,000 to buy merchandise. In this way her situation for investing would be resolved and she would just focus on selling the clothing and collecting the payments. 

Her biggest dream in life is to continue growing in her business and to move up to the highest category: 'emerald' level. She is very grateful to all the people who may help her to fulfil her dream and be in the place she wants to be.

loans.use: to have liquidity to invest in new merchandise.

loans.name: Doni

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Doni, one of Ruma’s agents. Doni lives in Yogyakarta, a city located about one hour by airplane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Happily married and the father of two daughters, Doni owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile airtime credits. Right now he is also becoming an agent for Ruma's e-commerce for lower communities called Mapan. 

Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Doni and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.
As a Mapan agent, Doni is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Doni will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer's house. With Mapan, Doni believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices. 

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Doni's shop so he can gives more contribution to his local community. Doni is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchasing products through Ruma's e-commerce for lower communities called Mapan.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo is married with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, where she takes care of additional family members. Victo sells green bananas at the market on retail basis. She works seven days a week and earns additional income farming. Her main challenge is the rainy season which makes transportation costs high. She lives in rented house with electricity and piped water and her monthly expenses include food and school fees.  

She is requesting for a loan to buy bunches of green bananas. She would like to buy more land to expand her farming.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is married, with five children who are in school. She makes her family's living by running a mattress shop. She does business from 7am to 06.30pm daily and she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

From Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Magdalena's fifth loan request, which she will use to restock on mattress to resell. With her previous loans, all of which were successfully paid back, she bought the same stocks to service more people. She used the increased income to cover school fees and home food expenses. She is very happy and thankful to everyone who has supported her. She dreams of expand her business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock on mattresses to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Teresita has been in this business for 8 years. Teresita earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 23 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a 43-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jona has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jona requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Jona has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jona would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 44 years old and married. She has seven children, six of whom are currently in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita works hard to support her family. Nita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional kilos of peanut, cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc.

Nita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of peanut, cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc

loans.name: Karla Veronica

texts.es:
Karla, es una mujer muy energética, abre su pulpería todos los días a las seis de la mañana y la cierra a las diez de la noche. Empezó su negocio vendiendo gaseosas y productos lácteos, con mucho esfuerzo, ahorrando y con el apoyo de su madre, ha hecho crecer su inventario. Siempre intenta mantener lo más abastecido para que sus clientes se vayan con lo que buscaban. 
Esta trabajadora mujer, sabe que entre más productos ofrezca, más clientes tendrá y crecerá cuanto se lo proponga. Es por eso que ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar granos básicos. En un futuro, Karla se ve siendo dueña de una gran miscelánea, distribuyéndole productos a las pulperías de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Karla is a very energetic woman who opens her grocery store at six in the morning and closes it at ten at night every day. 

She began her business selling sodas and dairy products. Through much effort, with her savings and her mother's support, she has expanded the inventory. She looks to keep high-demand items in stock, so that her clients can always find in her store what they are looking for.

This hardworking woman knows that a greater selection of products for sale will attract more clients, giving her the opportunity to grow the business as much as she wants. This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan through MiCrédito. She will buy basic grains.

In the future, Karla sees herself as the owner of a large general store, distributing to the small grocery stores in her community.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Kafedha

texts.en:
Kafedha is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kafedha operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 46-year-old married woman with ten children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lydia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc., for her business.

Lydia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 43-year-old married father of two children, who are enrolled in a private school.  He works hard to provide them with the necessary living needs.
He works in furniture making for twenty one years ago and he has special talents in this domain. This wide experience provides him with customers' support and trust. 

Hassan is an ambitious man, he puts so much effort on developing his career to make sure that he can provide his family with a better financially secured future.
To make sure that he can provide his children the best education, without affecting his business capital, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children school tuition fees, in addition to buying the necessary power generator, since his business is based on the presence of electricity, and his region lack this service.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his business in a well managed way to provide his beloved family a better living and his customers special services.

loans.use: To pay for his children school tuition fees, in addition to buying a necessary power generator for his business

loans.name: Pamela Lady

texts.es:
Pamela es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas, refrescos y arte en cartulina en kioscos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Miraflores’ caracterizada por encontrarse el estadio de futbol donde se celebran grandes eventos deportivos así como eventos musicales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.  
Pamela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja, Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y arte en cartulina; ella compra golosinas por mayor y las distribuye en diferentes kiscos y comercios, también realiza manualidades en goma eva, cartulina y otros materiales y los vende como adorno, letreros, etc., “aprendí el oficio de mi madre que vendía en este puesto anteriormente, también trabajo como parvulario por las mañanas…” comenta. Paralelamente a su actividad de venta de golosinas ella trabaja como parvularia, actividad que realiza por las mañanas para continuar con su negocio por las tardes. La ventaja de sus actividades es que son horarios diferentes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de un equipo de llamadas telefónicas para cobrar por su uso. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pamela solicita un préstamo para la compra de un equipo de llamadas telefónicas para cobrar por su uso y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pamela is a 29 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has no children. Her business is selling snacks and cardboard art from a kiosk.  

She is enterprising, stable, optimist, kind, responsible, and very hardworking. She runs her business in ‘Miraflores’, characterized by a soccer stadium where great sports events are held, as well as musical events. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 1-12 degrees centigrade. 

Pamela has dark skin, brown eyes, long, black hair that she wears loose, short stature, and a thin build. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish for the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her spouse, who works. They live in a rented house built from brick and cement with a metal sheeting roof and a wood floor. It has electricity, potable water and plumbing. Her business is selling snacks and cardboard art. She buys the snacks wholesale and distributes them in different kiosks and businesses. She also makes crafts from EVA rubber, cardboard, and other materials and sells them as decorations, signs, etc. “I learned this trade from my mother, who used to sell from this stall. I also work mornings in a kindergarten…,” she remarks. In addition to selling snacks, she works as a kindergarten teacher, an activity she does in the morning, while working at her business in the afternoon. The advantage of her activities is that they have different schedules. The disadvantage is a lack of investment capital. Her dream is to improve her business. She wants to buy telephone equipment to charge for its use. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the 6 years she has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Pamela is asking for a loan to buy telephone equipment to charge for its use and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy telephone equipment to charge for its use and improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor for their new tire-patching business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old and has five children. Evangeline is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Evangeline has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.es:
Jose encuentra en sus pollos esa oportunidad que siempre ha soñado de poder pagar una educación de calidad para sus hijos y tener el sustento diario para sobrevivir.

Hoy en día se siente muy orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora gracias a su dedicación, esfuerzo y trabajo duro.

Solicita un crédito para compra los materiales necesarios para la adecuación del galpón de sus pollos, además de comprar algunos pollos para la cría y gallinas ponedoras.

Es una actividad realizada con todo el cariño y empeño que solo un padre puede tener.
texts.en:
Jose finds In his chickens the opportunity that he has always dreamed of, being able to pay for a quality education for his children and having the daily sustenance to survive.

He now feels very proud of what he has been able to build so far thanks to his dedication, effort, and hard work.

He is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to make improvements to the chicken coop.  He will also buy some chickens to raise and laying hens.

It is a business activity that he does with all of the affection and effort that only a father can have.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to make improvements to the chicken coop and to buy some chickens to raise and laying hens.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: 35 летняя замечательная женщинаЗилола. Она прекрасная жена и матьь двоих детей. Детям 6 и 3 года. Зилола в городе Исфаре живет вместе с мужем, свекровью и детьми. Она рукодельница. Зилола шьет женские и мужские одежды на заказ.Она 10 летняя опытная швея. Зилола предоставляя швейной услуги зарабатывает и обеспечить семью. Она хотела расширить деятельность и увеличить ежедневный доход. Зилола просит кредит для купли ткани и швейные принадлежности для расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Зилола ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zilola, age 35, is a remarkable woman, a devoted wife and the mother of two children, who are now 6 and 3 years old.  She lives in the city of Isfara with her husband, her mother-in-law and her children.  She works as a seamstress and sews women's and men's clothes from orders that she gets from her customers.  She has 10 years of professional experience.  Thanks to her sewing activity, Zilola makes her own money and provides for her family.  She now wants to expand her activity and increase her daily income.  She is taking a loan to buy fabrics and sewing supplies, in order to expand her business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies, in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Titik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Titik, one of Ruma’s agents. Titik lives in one of the tourism cities in Indonesia called Yogyakarta, located about one hour by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married, and, together with her husband, has two daughters and one son.

Titik owns and manages a stall that sells Yogyakarta's handmade merchandise and also mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology, as well as give more of a contribution to her community.

As the business grows, Titik is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community.

With its demonstrated importance, your loan will be very useful to help Titik improve her business and, accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Titik is the one who is standing in her own stall while laughing. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid mobile airtime credit for helping local community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
