Rebecca is 54 years old and she lives alone. Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a jewelry and cloth business in Teshie-Accra and she is requesting a GHS 1,400 loan through ID Ghana to buy additional items to sell to customers, like jewelry and cloth.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid three loans from ID Ghana before this loan. She has been running the business for five years. Rebecca aspires to save enough money, so she can afford to take good care of herself.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to customers, like jewelry and cloth.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a resident of Angwete in Lira municipality. She is a single mother, with four schooling children that she is taking care of. Anna has a business sewing school uniforms. Her business helps her to make money for her children's education and other family needs. Due to the increasing demand for school uniforms in her area, Anna has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more inventory that will satisfy her customers' needs and adequately meet her family's needs. She is grateful to Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and Kiva lenders for the services rendered.

loans.use: To buy inventory of clothes to boost her sales

loans.name: Dalmecia

texts.es:
La socia  Dalmecia  se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Dalmecia works in crafts. She is an enterprising woman who wants to support her family through her business.

This member is requesting a loan to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms. She was happy with her previous loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
El socio Zenon se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, el socio vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, el socio es una persona trabjadora que por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Zenon still works in crafts. He sells fabric, sweaters, blankets, and looms. He is a hardworking person and he supports his family by means of this business.

This member is requesting this loan to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms. He was happy with his previous loan and promises to comply with his payment terms.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Carla Roselin

texts.es:
Carla tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos que brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría, y alimentos para engorde de los mismos. Con esto Carla espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carla is 33 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her son in the district of Nueva Arica, a rural area located in Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque, which is on Peru's northern coast. Its residents live quiet lives in this community, and mostly work in agriculture and retail.

She works raising and selling animals and has been doing this for over three years. She has experience in her field and regular customers who give her good references, both as a person and as a businesswoman. 

She will use this loan to buy more animals, as well as to maintain the area where she keeps them and buy feed to fatten them. With this investment, Carla expects to be able to offer her customers a wider array of animals, which will enable her to improve her income as well as her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, improve their stalls, and buy feed.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tarjetas prepago, recargas y chip para celulares desde hace 5 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 40, and her mother live in their own house.  Ana has made a living selling prepaid phone card and other mobile phone products for 5 years.  She operates the business from her house and has many customers.  Her earnings from the business cover the family's expenses.  Ana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of the products she sells.  The investment will allow her to carry on the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to stock her phone sales business.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en el caserio Santa Clara que pertenece al distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Alfonso se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Alfonso espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 61, lives in Santa Clara, a rural town in Peru's northern mountains.  He has a modest house there where he lives with his wife and son.  Life in Santa Clara is quiet and peaceful.  Farming, raising animals and running small businesses are common occupations for local people.  

Alfonso makes a living growing coffee.  He has long experience growing coffee and many good references to both his character and his work.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for the labor and supplies he needs for his next harvest.  The investment will help him to deliver a good-quality crop to his customers and, in turn, provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Agripina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de complementos alimenticios, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere abrir otro negocio donde pueda vender los complementos alimenticios. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar complementos alimenticios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Agripina, continues to work selling food supplements. The member is a hard working woman who wants to open another business where she can sell food supplements. The member is requesting the loan to purchase food supplements.

She  is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase food supplements.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Felisa is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Felisa has been farming vegetables for two years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Maria Elizabeth continues to sell food. The member is a hard working and entrepreneur woman and through this business she supports her family. The member is requesting this loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 42-year-old married woman with three children who works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 4 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

In the future Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 38-year-old married woman with three children who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 5 years and requests 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase soap, milk, canned goods, chips, and eggs.

Dina has previously repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She earns additional income raising goats.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, canned goods, chips, and eggs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 25-year-old married man.  He is also a staff member in a company.  He is from the Takeo Province in Cambodia. He has worked at a company in the city since 2011, earning an income of 8.3 USD per day. His wife is 21 years old and she is a staff member in a company, earning an income of 5 USD per day. 

Currently, Lina is pursuing a bachelor’s degree in economics at a university in the city. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his fourth-year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. This is his second loan cycle with Kiva. With this loan, he will have enough finances to cover his fourth-year university fees and complete the year successfully. Lina dreams of finding a better job with a reasonable salary, and he also wants to save money to build his own house in the city.

loans.use: pay his fourth-year tuition fees

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 45-year-old married mother of five children.  She works hard to support her husband in increasing their family's income to cover their children increasing living and education needs, especially now that three of her children are enrolled in a private school and two in public school.

A year ago, Sabah decided to open a shop selling construction supplies.  She currently specializes in painting supplies.  Since her husband works as a house painter she found it easy to run the business and most of her customers trust dealing with her.

Since her business is still new, Sabah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special construction accessories and hardware highly requested by her customers.  She hopes to stay capable of expanding her business and increasing her merchandise, so that one day she can move her two children from the public school to a private one.

loans.use: buy construction supplies

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 30-year-old married woman from a village near the city of Hebron. Her husband is a taxi driver and earnsan unstable income. Areej has a store to sell and rend wedding and party dresses. It is a very good business and the demand is high. Areej receives her products from a very good company to insure she has a good quality. 

Areej took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new collection of dresses. This will increase her income and she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of dresses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 52-year-old married mother of four children.

In 2012 she opened her own unique shop, where she provides her customers diversified services.
Mariam sells clothes, accessories and at the same time she provides hairdressing and makeup services to make sure that her customers are pleased with everything they get from one place. She supports her husband in covering their beloved family's needs. With one of her children enrolled in a private school, she works especially hard to provide him with the best education.

Mariam is acquiring her first loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the special summer collection, highly requested by her customers.
She is working hard to develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with the special summer collection which is highly requested by her customers.

loans.name: Bunda Upendo Group

texts.en: Hamisi is married with five children. He has been selling second-hand clothes for five years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Hamisi's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to continue increasing his second-hand clothes stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy first-class second-hand clothes to meet his customers' requirements and demands. He dreams of buying a big stock of second-hand clothes. He will share this loan with his loan group, BUNDA UPENDO GROUP, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en: Tursunoi is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. She lives in a big remote town with her family. She is married and has one child. She has 20 years of experience doing business in the domestic market. She is busy buying and selling traditional napkins and carpets for praying. Her husband is a farmer. She and her daughter embroider traditional ornaments to textiles. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy the necessary items for embroidering and enlarging her assortment of traditional napkins and carpets for praying. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy the necessary items for embroidering and enlarging her assortment of traditional napkins and carpets for praying.

loans.name: Mizraim Frecia

texts.es:
La socia Mizraim Frecia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mizraim Frecia continues working in her business selling natural products. Through her business, she wants to provide for her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase natural products.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase natural products.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman  with five children, all  attend school. They live at their own house that is without electricity and running water. 

She has operated a home-based fish selling business for  ten years. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

She wants to purchase bundles of fish and dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish..
